Why Go?
为什么要去？

You can’t see the Great Wall from space, but you’d have a job missing Shanghai (上海, Shànghǎi). One of the country’s largest and most vibrant cities, Shanghai somehow typifies modern China while being unlike anywhere else in the land. Shanghai is real China, but – rather like Hong Kong or Macau – just not the China you had in mind.
你无法从太空看到长城，但你会有一份工作错过上海（ 上海 ，Shànghǎi）。上海是中国最大、最具活力的城市之一，在某种程度上代表了现代中国，同时又与这片土地上的其他任何地方都不同。上海是真正的中国，但就像香港或澳门一样，只是不是你心目中的中国。

This is a city of action and few places in the world evoke so much history, excess, glamour, mystique and exotic promise in name alone. It best serves as an epilogue to your China experience: submit to its charms after you’ve had your fill of dusty imperial palaces and bumpy 10-hour bus rides. From fancy dining, shopping and skyscraper-hopping to bullet-fast Maglev trains and glamorous cocktails – enjoy Shanghai.
这是一座充满行动的城市，世界上很少有地方能仅凭名义唤起如此多的历史、过度、魅力、神秘和异国情调。它最适合作为您中国体验的尾声：在您吃够了尘土飞扬的皇宫和颠簸的 10 小时巴士之旅后，屈服于它的魅力。从高档餐饮、购物和摩天大楼跳跃，到子弹飞速的磁悬浮列车和迷人的鸡尾酒——享受上海的乐趣。

When to Go
何时去

Feb or Mar Visit Yùyuán Gardens for the lantern festival, two weeks after Chinese New Year.
2 月或 3 月参观玉园参加元宵节，农历新年两周后。

Apr & May March is chilly and 1 May is chaos, but otherwise spring is ideal.
4 月和 5 月三月寒冷，5 月 1 日混乱，但除此之外，春天是理想的选择。

Late Sep–Oct The optimal season: neither too hot nor too rainy.
9 月下旬至 10 月最佳季节：既不太热也不太下雨。

Shanghai Highlights
上海亮点

1 The Bund Strolling along Shanghai’s famous promenade with Mainland China’s most iconic concession-era district as a backdrop.
1 外滩漫步在上海著名的海滨长廊上，以中国大陆最具标志性的租界时代区为背景。

2 Shanghai Tower Gazing down on the Shanghai cityscape from the 118th-floor (632m) observation of China’s tallest building.
2 上海中心大厦 从 118 层（632 米）的中国最高建筑观景俯瞰上海城市景观。

3 Yuyuan Gardens Seeking out a quiet corner among the ponds, trees, bridges, pavilions and harmonic compositions within one of the country’s best traditional gardens.
3 豫园 在全国最好的传统花园之一的池塘、树木、桥梁、亭台楼阁和和谐的构图中寻找一个安静的角落。

4 Jade Buddha Temple Witnesses a continual stream of worshippers at this iconic, century-old Buddhist temple.
4 玉佛寺 这座标志性的百年佛教寺庙见证了络绎不绝的参拜者。

5 Shanghai Museum Browsing everything from ancient bronzes and gorgeous Qing-dynasty ceramic masterpieces to the wonders of the natural world.
5 上海博物馆 从古代青铜器、华丽的清代陶瓷杰作到自然界的奇观，应有尽有。

6 M50 Perusing cutting-edge contemporary art, photography and collaborative works in spaces repurposed from former factories and cotton mills.
6 M50 在由前工厂和棉纺厂改造而成的空间中仔细阅读尖端的当代艺术、摄影和合作作品。

History
历史

Over just a few centuries, Shanghai transformed from an insignificant walled town south of the mouth of the Yangzi River to China’s leading and wealthiest metropolis. A dizzying swirl of opium, trade, foreign control, vice, glamour, glitz, rebellion, restoration and money, Shanghai’s story is a rags-to-riches saga of decadence, exploitation and, ultimately, achievement.
在短短几个世纪的时间里，上海从扬子江口以南的一个微不足道的城墙小镇变成了中国领先和最富有的大都市。鸦片、贸易、外国管制、罪恶、魅力、浮华、叛乱、复辟和金钱的令人眼花缭乱的漩涡，上海的故事是一个白手起家的颓废、剥削和最终成就的传奇。

As the gateway to the Yangzi River (Chang Jiang), Shanghai (the name means ‘by the sea’) has long been an ideal trading port. However, although it supported as many as 50,000 residents by the late 17th century, it wasn’t until after the British opened their concession here in 1842 that modern Shanghai really came into being.
作为长江的门户，上海（名字的意思是“海边”）长期以来一直是理想的贸易港口。然而，尽管到 17 世纪末，它养活了多达 50,000 名居民，但直到 1842 年英国人在这里开设租界后，现代上海才真正应运而生。

The British were soon followed by the French and Americans, and by 1853 Shanghai had overtaken all other Chinese ports. Built on the trade of opium, silk and tea, the city also lured the world’s big banks, which erected palaces on the Bund. Shanghai also became a byword for exploitation and vice; its countless opium dens, gambling joints and brothels managed by gangs were at the heart of Shanghai life. Guarding it all were the American, French and Italian marines, British Tommies and Japanese bluejackets.
英国人很快就被法国人和美国人追随，到 1853 年，上海已经占领了中国所有其他港口。这座城市建立在鸦片、丝绸和茶叶的贸易之上，还吸引了世界大银行，这些银行在外滩上建造了宫殿。上海也成为剥削和罪恶的代名词;无数的鸦片窝点、赌场和帮派管理的妓院是上海生活的核心。守卫这一切的是美国、法国和意大利的海军陆战队、英国的汤米和日本的蓝夹克军。

After Chiang Kaishek’s coup against the communists in 1927, the Kuomintang cooperated with the foreign police and the Shanghai gangs, and with Chinese and foreign factory owners, to suppress labour unrest. Exploited in workhouse conditions, crippled by hunger and poverty, sold into slavery, and excluded from the high life and the parks created by the foreigners, the poor of Shanghai formed the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) here in 1921 and, after numerous setbacks, became the new governors of the city in 1949.
1927 年蒋介石反共政变后，国民党与外国警察和上海黑帮以及中外工厂主合作，镇压劳工骚乱。上海的穷人在济贫院的条件下被剥削，因饥饿和贫困而瘫痪，被卖为奴隶，被排除在外国人创造的上流生活和公园之外，他们于 1921 年在这里组建了中国共产党 （CCP），并在经历了无数挫折后，于 1949 年成为该市的新任省长。

The communists eradicated the slums, rehabilitated the city’s hundreds of thousands of opium addicts, and eliminated child and slave labour. These were staggering achievements. Shanghai then became a factory town and political hotbed, and was the power base of the influential Gang of Four during the Cultural Revolution.
共产党人铲除了贫民窟，使该市数十万鸦片成瘾者康复，并消除了童工和奴隶劳动。这些都是惊人的成就。上海随后成为工厂城镇和政治温床，是文革期间颇具影响力的四人帮的权力基地。

Shanghai’s announcement of plans to develop Pudong, on the eastern side of the Huangpu River, came in 1990. Since then the city’s burgeoning economy, leadership and intrinsic self-confidence have put it miles ahead of other Chinese cities. Its bright lights and opportunities have branded Shanghai a mecca for Chinese (and foreign) economic migrants. In 2010, 3600 people were squeezed into every square kilometre, compared with 2588 per sq km in 2000, and by 2014 the city’s population had leaped to a staggering 24 million. Over nine million migrants have made Shanghai home, colouring the local complexion with a jumble of dialects, outlooks, lifestyles and cuisines.
上海宣布开发位于黄浦江东侧的浦东的计划是在1990年。从那时起，这座城市蓬勃发展的经济、领导力和内在的自信使其远远领先于其他中国城市。上海的璀璨灯光和机遇使上海成为中国（和外国）经济移民的圣地。2010 年，每平方公里挤压了 3600 人，而 2000 年为每平方公里 2588 人，到 2014 年，该市的人口已跃升至惊人的 2400 万。超过 900 万移民以上海为家，为当地人增添了各种方言、风景、生活方式和美食。

The task of the Chinese leadership now demands a more pressing focus on balancing the economy away from its export and high-investment model, rooting out corruption, attempting to tame the rampant property market (as apartment prices put home ownership beyond the reach of most) and narrowing the chasm dividing low-wage earners from the wealthy elites. In recent years, the issue of migrant workers’ rights in Shanghai and other cities became paramount, as workers sought to bring their rights (education for their children and access to health care) closer to native Shanghainese. Meanwhile Shanghai reached record-breaking levels of atmospheric pollutants, and in 2018 it superseded the capital on smog levels. Authorities have set targets to make serious reductions.
中国领导层现在的任务需要更紧迫地关注平衡经济，摆脱出口和高投资模式，根除腐败，试图驯服猖獗的房地产市场（因为公寓价格使大多数人无法拥有住房）以及缩小低收入者与富裕精英之间的鸿沟。近年来，上海和其他城市的农民工权利问题变得至关重要，因为工人试图使他们的权利（子女的教育和获得医疗保健的机会）更接近上海本土人。与此同时，上海的大气污染物水平达到了创纪录的水平，并在 2018 年的雾霾水平上超过了首都。当局已经设定了大幅削减的目标。

Language
语言

Outside hotels, English is not widely spoken, and even less so outside the city. You’ll be able to get by in tourist areas, but it’s useful to learn a few basic phrases. Some restaurants may not have an English menu. You’ll find yourself surrounded by written Chinese wherever you travel, so the Pleco app (www.pleco.com) or phrasebook is useful, or you can always call Shanghai Call Centre (%021 962 288) for on the spot translations.
在酒店之外，英语并不广泛使用，在城外更不用说了。您将能够在旅游区度过难关，但学习一些基本短语很有用。有些餐厅可能没有英文菜单。无论您旅行到哪里，您都会发现自己被书面中文包围，因此 Pleco 应用程序 （www.pleco.com） 或短语手册很有用，或者您可以随时致电上海呼叫中心 （ % 021 962 288） 进行现场翻译。

1Sights
1 景点

1The Bund & People’s Square
1 外滩和人民广场

oThe BundARCHITECTURE
o 外滩建筑

(外滩, Wàitān; map Google map; 3 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 3中山东一路; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 外滩 ，Wàitān; 地图谷歌地图 ;3 中山东 m 一路 南京东路

Symbolic of concession-era Shanghai, the Bund was the city’s Wall Street, a place of feverish trading and fortunes made and lost. Originally a towpath for dragging barges of rice, the Bund (an Anglo-Indian term for the embankment of a muddy waterfront) was gradually transformed into a grandiose sweep of the most powerful banks and trading houses in Shanghai. The optimal activity here is to simply stroll, contrasting the bones of the past with the futuristic geometry of Pudong’s skyline.
外滩是租界时代上海的象征，是这座城市的华尔街，是一个狂热的贸易和财富的创造和损失的地方。外滩（英印语中意为泥泞海滨的堤坝）最初是拖运大米驳船的拖道，后来逐渐转变为上海最强大的银行和贸易行的宏伟扫荡。这里的最佳活动是简单地漫步，将过去的骨头与浦东天际线的未来几何形状形成鲜明对比。

The majority of the art deco and neoclassical buildings here were built in the early 20th century and presented an imposing – if strikingly un-Chinese – view for those nosing by boat into the busy port city. Today it has emerged as a designer retail and restaurant zone, and the city’s most exclusive boutiques, restaurants and hotels see the Bund as the only place to be. Evening visits are rewarded by electric views of Pudong and the illuminated grandeur of the Bund. Other options include taking a boat tour on the Huangpu River or relaxing at some fabulous bars and restaurants. Huangpu Park, at the north end of the promenade, features the modest Bund History Museum map Google map (外滩历史纪念馆, Wàitān Lìshǐ Jìniànguǎn; h9am-4pm Mon-Fri) F, which contains a collection of old photographs and maps.
这里的大部分装饰艺术和新古典主义建筑建于 20 世纪初，为那些乘船进入繁忙港口城市的人提供了雄伟的——尽管非常非中国——景色。如今，它已成为设计师零售和餐饮区，该市最独特的精品店、餐厅和酒店将外滩视为唯一的地方。晚上参观时，可以欣赏到浦东的电光璀璨的景色和外滩灯火通明的壮丽景色。其他选择包括乘船游览黄浦江或在一些一流的酒吧和餐厅放松身心。黄浦公园位于长廊的北端，拥有朴素的外滩历史博物馆地图 Google map（ 外滩历史纪念馆 ， Wàitān Lìshǐ Jìniànguǎn; h 周一至周五上午 9 点至下午 4 点）， F 其中包含一系列旧照片和地图。

Get here early for the intriguing sight of the morning exercises.
早点到达这里，欣赏晨练的有趣景象。

oShanghai History MuseumMUSEUM
o 上海历史博物馆 MUSEUM

(上海市历史博物馆, Shànghǎi Shì Lìshǐ Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %021 6323 2504; 325 Nanjing West Rd, 南京西路325号; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; mPeople’s Square) F
（ 上海市历史博物馆 ，Shànghǎi Shì Lìshǐ Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6323 2504; 南京西路南京西路 325 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间为下午 4 点; m 人民广场） F

Originally opened as the Shanghai Race Club in 1934, and having undergone several incarnations since, this iconic building now houses the Shanghai History Museum. Opened in 2018, the museum covers the city’s history over three floors, spanning the Shanghai area’s political, social, economic and cultural evolution from 4000 BC to the founding of the People’s Republic of China in 1949. You’re bound to gain some insight, political propaganda notwithstanding.
这座标志性建筑最初于 1934 年作为上海赛马俱乐部开业，此后经历了多次改建，现在是上海历史博物馆的所在地。该博物馆于 2018 年开放，涵盖了上海的历史，共有三层，涵盖了上海地区从公元前 4000 年到 1949 年中华人民共和国成立的政治、社会、经济和文化演变。尽管有政治宣传，你一定会获得一些见解。

The well-chosen displays on the 2nd floor showcase the Shanghai Majiabang (approximately dated to the 4th or 5th century BC), Songze and Liangzhu periods and beyond. Particularly insightful is the documentation of the ways in which geology influenced the area’s early development – the relationship between land and water was skillfully managed by inhabitants to make it the thriving trade city that it later became. The 3rd and 4th floors focus on the colonial strivings for Shanghai – specifically the 19th-century period of British, French and US dominance – and the way that the Opium Wars influenced the commerce, trade and wealth of the city and devastated its population.
二楼精心挑选的陈列展示了上海马家浜（大约可追溯到公元前 4 世纪或 5 世纪）、崧泽和良渚时期及以后。特别有见地的是地质学影响该地区早期发展的方式的记录——土地和水之间的关系被居民巧妙地管理，使其成为后来繁荣的贸易城市。三楼和四楼的重点是对上海的殖民斗争——特别是 19 世纪英国、法国和美国的统治时期——以及鸦片战争如何影响这座城市的商业、贸易和财富，并摧毁了它的人口。

Expect archaeological findings, interactive digital displays, maps, dioramas, and recreations of Shanghai street scenes. Count on spending a couple of hours here; you can finish by having food or drink at Roof 325 map Google map (屋顶325, Wūdǐng 325; %021 6327 0767; www.roof325.com; 2-course set lunch ¥138, à la carte meals ¥450-1500; h10.30am-11.30pm) on the 5th floor.
期待考古发现、交互式数字展示、地图、立体模型和上海街景的娱乐。指望在这里度过几个小时;您可以在 Roof 325 地图 Google map（ 屋顶 325， Wūdǐng 325; % 021 6327 0767;www.roof325.com;2 道菜套餐午餐¥138，单点¥450-1500; h 上午 10：30 至晚上 11：30） 位于 5 楼。

oRockbund Art MuseumMUSEUM
o 上海外滩美术馆 MUSEUM

(RAM, 上海外滩美术馆, Shànghǎi Wàitān Měishù-guǎn; map Google map; www.rockbundartmuseum.org; 20 Huqiu Rd, 虎丘路20号; adult/child ¥50/20; h10am-6pm Tue-Sun; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（RAM， 上海外滩美术馆 ， Shànghǎi Wàitān Měishù-guǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.rockbundartmuseum.org;虎丘路虎丘路 20 号 ;成人/儿童 ¥50/20; h 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 6 点; m 南京东路）

Housed in the magnificent former Royal Asiatic Society building (1932) – once Shanghai’s first museum – this world-class gallery behind the Bund focuses on contemporary Chinese and international art, with rotating exhibits year-round and no permanent collection. One of the city’s top modern-art venues, the building’s interior and exterior are both sublime. Check out the unique art deco eightsided bāguà (trigram) windows at the front, a fetching synthesis of western modernist styling and traditional Chinese design.
这家位于外滩后面的世界级画廊位于宏伟的前皇家亚洲学会大楼（1932 年）内，曾经是上海的第一座博物馆，专注于中国当代和国际艺术，全年轮流展出，没有永久收藏。作为该市顶级现代艺术场所之一，该建筑的内部和外部都非常壮丽。看看前面独特的装饰艺术风格的八边八卦（卦 ）窗户，这是西方现代主义风格和中国传统设计的迷人综合体。

The interior is all textbook deco lines and curves, including the fine staircase. Head to the rooftop terrace for excellent views, despite the hulking form of the Peninsula Hotel blocking out much of Lujiazui. Admission includes a free coffee from the top-floor cafe.
内部都是教科书式的装饰线条和曲线，包括精美的楼梯。前往屋顶露台欣赏美景，尽管半岛酒店的庞大形式挡住了陆家嘴的大部分地区。门票包括顶楼咖啡厅的免费咖啡。

oShanghai Urban Planning Exhibition HallMUSEUM
o 上海市城市规划展览馆 MUSEUM

(上海城市规划展示馆, Shànghǎi Chéngshì Guīhuà Zhǎnshìguǎn; map Google map; 100 Renmin Ave, entrance on Middle Xizang Rd, 人民大道100号西藏中路入口; adult/child ¥30/15; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; mPeople’s Square)
（ 上海城市规划展示馆 ， Shànghǎi Chéngshì Guīhuà Zhǎnshìguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;人民大道 100 号西藏中路入口; 成人/儿童 30/15 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间下午 4 点; m 人民广场）

Set over five levels, this modern museum covers Shanghai’s urban planning history, tracing its development from swampy fishing village to modern-day megacity. Its mix of photography, models and interactive multimedia displays keeps things entertaining. The 1st floor covers the city’s rise, including the establishment of the international settlement, and profiles its colonial architecture and shíkùmén (stone gate) housing. The most popular feature is on the 3rd floor – a visually stunning model showing a detailed layout of the megalopolisto-be, plus an impressive Virtual World 3D wrap-around tour.
这座现代化的博物馆分为五层，涵盖了上海的城市规划历史，追溯了上海从沼泽渔村到现代特大城市的发展历程。它结合了摄影、模型和交互式多媒体显示器，让事情变得有趣。一楼涵盖了这座城市的崛起，包括国际定居点的建立，并介绍了其殖民时期的建筑和石门（石门）住房。最受欢迎的功能位于 3 楼——一个视觉上令人惊叹的模型，展示了大都市的详细布局，以及令人印象深刻的虚拟世界 3D 环绕式游览。

The 4th floor is a bit more niche, covering themes of transport and sustainability, but all is well presented. There’s a small cafe on the 5th floor overlooking People’s Park. Audio guides are ¥20, but exhibits are generally well captioned. The 2nd floor shows temporary exhibits.
4 楼更小众一些，涵盖了交通和可持续发展的主题，但一切都得到了很好的呈现。5楼有一家小咖啡馆，可以俯瞰人民公园。语音导览价格为 20 日元，但展品通常都有很好的字幕。2楼展示临时展品。

Upon exiting you’ll find yourself in ‘Old Shanghai Street’, a recreation of 1930s Shanghai, complete with vintage cars, historical photographs and a cobblestone walkway that leads to a modern underground shopping plaza.
离开后，您会发现自己身处“老上海街”，这是 1930 年代上海的再现，配有老爷车、历史照片和通往现代地下购物广场的鹅卵石人行道。

oShanghai MuseumMUSEUM
o 上海博物馆 MUSEUM

(上海博物馆, Shànghǎi Bówùguǎn; map Google map; www.shanghaimuseum.net; 201 People’s Ave, 201人民大道; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; c; mPeople’s Square) F
（ 上海博物馆 ，Shànghǎi Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.shanghaimuseum.net;201 People's Ave， 201 人民大道 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间为下午 4 点; c m 人民广场） F

This must-see museum escorts you through the craft of millennia and the pages of Chinese history. It’s home to one of the most impressive collections in the land: take your pick from the archaic green patinas of the Ancient Chinese Bronzes Gallery through to the silent solemnity of the Ancient Chinese Sculpture Gallery and from the exquisite beauty of the ceramics in the Zande Lou Gallery to the measured and timeless flourishes captured in the Chinese Calligraphy Gallery.
这座必看的博物馆将带您领略千年的工艺和中国历史的篇章。这里拥有这片土地上最令人印象深刻的藏品之一：从中国古代青铜画廊的古老绿色铜绿到中国古代雕塑画廊的静谧庄严，从赞德楼画廊的陶瓷之美，再到中国书法画廊中捕捉到的有节制和永恒的华丽，任您挑选。

Chinese painting, seals, jade, Ming and Qing furniture, coins and ethnic costumes are also on offer, intelligently displayed in well-lit galleries. The building itself is designed to resemble the shape of an ancient Chinese dǐng (three-legged cooking vessel). The excellent museum shop sells postcards, a rich array of books, and faithful replicas of the museum’s ceramics and other pieces.
还提供中国画、印章、玉器、明清家具、钱币和民族服饰，在光线充足的画廊中巧妙地展示。建筑本身的设计类似于中国古代 dǐng（三足烹饪容器）的形状。一流的博物馆商店出售明信片、种类繁多的书籍以及博物馆陶瓷和其他作品的忠实复制品。

The audio guide is well worth the ¥40 (deposit ¥400 or your passport). Expect to spend half, if not most of, a day here.
语音导览非常值得 40 日元（押金 400 日元或您的护照）。预计一天中有一半（如果不是大部分）在这里度过。

Former British ConsulateHISTORIC BUILDING
前英国领事馆历史建筑

(英国驻上海总领事馆, Yīngguó Zhù Shànghǎi Zǒng Lǐngshìguǎn; map Google map; 33 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 33中山東路1号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 英国驻上海总领事馆 ， Yīngguó Zhù Shànghǎi Zǒng Lǐngshìguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;33 中山东路 1 号， 33 中山东路 1 号 m 南京东路）

The original British Consulate was one of the first foreign buildings to go up in Shanghai in 1852, though it was destroyed in a fire and replaced with the current structure in 1873. Now renovated, it is used as a financiers’ club and restaurant, No 1 Waitanyuan map Google map (外滩源一号, Wàitān Yuán Yī Hào; %021 5308 9803; platter for 2 people ¥320; hhigh tea 2-5pm), which serves high tea. Also within the grounds are the former Consul’s Residence (1884) – now a flagship Patek Philippe store – and several century-old magnolia trees.
原来的英国领事馆是 1852 年在上海拔地而起的第一批外国建筑之一，尽管它在一场大火中被烧毁，并于 1873 年被现在的建筑所取代。现已翻修，用作金融家俱乐部和餐厅， 怀坦园 1 号地图 Google map（ 外滩源一号 ，Wàitān Yuán Yī Hào; % 021 5308 9803;2 人拼盘 ¥320; h 下午 2 点至 5 点下午茶）供应下午茶。场地内还有前领事官邸（1884 年）——现在是百达翡丽旗舰店——和几棵百年木兰树。

Hongkong & Shanghai Bank BuildingHISTORIC BUILDING
香港上海银行大厦历史建筑

(HSBC Building, 汇丰大厦; map Google map; 12 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路12号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（汇丰大厦汇丰大厦; 地图谷歌地图 ;中山东一路 12 号， 中山东一路 12 号 m 南京东路）

Adjacent to the Custom House, the Hongkong & Shanghai Bank Building was constructed in 1923. The bank was first established in Hong Kong in 1864 and in Shanghai in 1865 to finance trade, and soon became one of the richest in Shanghai, arranging the indemnity paid after the Boxer Rebellion. The magnificent mosaic ceiling inside the entrance was plastered over until its restoration in 1997 and is therefore well preserved.
毗邻海关大楼的香港上海银行大楼建于 1923 年。该银行于 1864 年在香港成立，并于 1865 年在上海成立，为贸易提供资金，并很快成为上海最富有的银行之一，安排义和团运动后支付的赔款。入口内宏伟的马赛克天花板一直被抹灰，直到 1997 年修复，因此保存完好。

It depicts 12 zodiac signs, eight cities with HSBC branches and 16 Greek characters. Photography is not allowed inside.
它描绘了 12 个星座、8 个设有汇丰银行分行的城市和 16 个希腊字符。内部不允许拍照。

Custom HouseNOTABLE BUILDING
海关大楼著名建筑

(自订的房子, Zì Dìng De Fángzi; map Google map; 13 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路13号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 自订的房子 ，Zì Dìng De Fángzi; 地图谷歌地图 ; 中山东一路 13 号， 中山东一路 13 号 m 南京东路）

The neoclassical Custom House, established at this site in 1857 and rebuilt in 1927, is one of the most important buildings on the Bund. Capping it is Big Ching, a bell modelled on London’s Big Ben. Clocks were by no means new to China, but Shanghai was the first city in which they gained widespread acceptance and the lives of many became dictated by a standardised, common schedule.
新古典主义海关大楼于 1857 年在此建立，并于 1927 年重建，是外滩最重要的建筑之一。它的顶部是 Big Ching，一个仿照伦敦大本钟的钟。钟表对中国来说绝不是新鲜事，但上海是第一个被广泛接受的城市，许多人的生活被标准化的、共同的时间表所决定。

During the Cultural Revolution, Big Ching was replaced with loudspeakers that blasted out revolutionary songs (‘The East is Red’) and slogans. Look for the socialist realism plaque outside its front door, depicting scenes from the ‘liberation’ of Shanghai.
文化大革命期间，大清被扬声器所取代，扬声器播放革命歌曲（“东方是红色”）和口号。寻找前门外的社会主义现实主义牌匾，描绘了上海“解放”的场景。

Yuanmingyuan RoadAREA
圆明园路 AREA

(圆明园路, Yuánmíngyuán Lù; map Google map; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 圆明园路 ，Yuánmíngyuán Lù; 地图谷歌地图 ; m 南京东路）

Like a smaller, more condensed version of the Bund, the pedestrianised, cobblestone Yuanmingyuan Rd is lined with a mishmash of colonial architecture. Running parallel with the Bund, just one block back, the road features some fine examples of renovated red-brick and stone buildings dating from the 1900s. Look for the art deco YWCA building (No 133) and Chinese Baptist Publication building (No 209), the ornate 1907 red-brick Panama Legation building (No 97) and the 1927 neoclassical Lyceum building.
就像外滩的更小、更浓缩的版本一样，圆明园路的鹅卵石步行街两旁是殖民时期建筑的混杂。这条路与外滩平行，仅一个街区，有一些经过翻新的红砖和石头建筑的精美例子，其历史可追溯至 1900 年代。寻找装饰艺术风格的基督教女青年会大楼（133 号）和中国浸信会出版社大楼（209 号）、华丽的 1907 年红砖巴拿马公使馆大楼（97 号）和 1927 年新古典主义的兰心大楼。

AroundSpaceGALLERY
AroundSpace 画廊

(周围艺术画廊, Zhōuwéi Yìshù Huàláng; map Google map; www.aroundspace.gallery; 33 Middle Sichuan Rd, 四川中路33号; h10.30am-6pm Tue-Sun; mEast Nanjing Rd) F
（ 周围艺术画廊 ，Zhōuwéi Yìshù Huàláng; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.aroundspace.gallery; 四川中路 h 33 号 10.30am-6pm m 南京东路） F

Housed in a beautiful 1932 art deco building, that – like several other galleries in the area – was formerly a Chinese bank, AroundSpace is an elegant art gallery. Several exhibitions are hosted concurrently, with a focus on emerging and established contemporary artists from China.
AroundSpace 坐落在一栋美丽的 1932 年装饰艺术建筑内，与该地区的其他几家画廊一样，它以前是一家中国银行，是一家优雅的艺术画廊。同时举办多个展览，重点展示来自中国的新兴和知名当代艺术家。

Get in touch with owner Ming Ming to arrange free art tours in the area.
与业主 Ming Ming 联系，安排该地区的免费艺术之旅。

PearlLam GalleriesGALLERY
PearlLam Galleries 画廊

(珍珠林画廊, Zhēnzhū Lín Huàláng; map Google map; www.pearllam.com; 181 Middle Jiangxi Rd, 江西中路181号; h10.30am-7pm; mEast Nanjing Rd) F
（ 珍珠林画廊 ， Zhēnzhū Lín Huàláng; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.pearllam.com;江西中路江西中路 181 号 h 10.30am-7pm; m 南京东路） F

The Shanghai branch of this Hong Kong contemporary gallery is set within an old bank building dating from 1936. With a mix of Chinese and international abstract artists, it’s definitely worth popping in to see what’s showing. There’s also another exhibition space in the somewhat creepy basement. It’s part of the Art on the Bund gallery precinct.
这家香港当代画廊的上海分馆位于一栋建于 1936 年的旧银行大楼内。这里汇集了中国和国际抽象艺术家，绝对值得一去看看正在展出的东西。在有点令人毛骨悚然的地下室里还有另一个展览空间。它是外滩艺术画廊区的一部分。

Glen Line Steamship Co.HISTORIC BUILDING
格伦莱恩轮船公司历史建筑

(葛籣线轮船公司, Gé Lán Xiàn Lúnchuán Gōngsī; map Google map; 28 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路28号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 葛籣线轮船公司 ， Gé Lán Xiàn Lúnchuán Gōngsī; 地图谷歌地图 ;中山东一路 28 号中山东一路 28 号 m 南京东路）

This elegant 1922 neoclassical building served as the office of a British shipping company before being occupied by the Japanese during WWII and serving as an interim German consulate (directly opposite the British embassy at No 27). Following the war it was briefly the US consulate before becoming the headquarters for Shanghai People’s radio station during the Cultural Revolution. Today it’s the office for Shanghai Clearing House.
这座优雅的 1922 年新古典主义建筑曾是一家英国航运公司的办公室，在二战期间被日本人占领并作为德国临时领事馆（位于 27 号英国大使馆正对面）。战后，它曾短暂地成为美国领事馆，然后在文化大革命期间成为上海人民广播电台的总部。今天，它是上海清算所的办公室。

Bank of Communications BuildingHISTORIC BUILDING
交通银行大厦历史建筑

(中国银行通信大楼, Zhōngguó Yínháng Tōngxìn Dàlóu; map Google map; 14 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路14号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 中国银行通信大楼 ， Zhōngguó Yínháng Tōngxìn Dàlóu; 地图谷歌地图 ; 中山东一路 m 14 号南京东路

With the Bund offering a showcase of the world’s great architecture styles, representing art deco is the Bank of Communications Building with its classic geometric facade dating from 1948.
外滩展示了世界伟大的建筑风格，代表装饰艺术的是交通银行大厦，其经典的几何外观可追溯至 1948 年。

Jardine MathesonHISTORIC BUILDING
怡和历史建筑

(怡和洋行, Yí Hé Yángháng; map Google map; 27 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路27号; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 怡和洋行 ，Yí Hé Yángháng; 地图谷歌地图 ; 中山东一路 27 号 m 南京东路中山东一路

Standing at No 27 on the Bund is the former headquarters of early opium traders Jardine Matheson, which went on to become one of the most powerful trading houses in Hong Kong and Shanghai. Also known as EWO, it was the first foreign company to erect a building on the Bund in 1851. It later invested in China’s earliest railways and cotton mills, and even operated a popular brewery. The current building replaced the original and was completed in 1922 in British Renaissance style.
位于外滩 27 号的是早期鸦片贸易商怡和洋行的前总部，该公司后来成为香港和上海最强大的贸易公司之一。它也被称为 EWO，是 1851 年第一家在外滩建造建筑的外国公司。后来，它投资了中国最早的铁路和棉纺厂，甚至经营了一家受欢迎的啤酒厂。现在的建筑取代了原来的建筑，于 1922 年竣工，具有英国文艺复兴风格。

In 1941 the British Embassy occupied the top floor, facing the German Embassy across the road in the Glen Line building, at No 28. Jardine Matheson now holds the House of Roosevelt, which is quite possibly China’s largest wine cellar and bar.
1941 年，英国大使馆占据了顶层，与德国大使馆对面位于 28 号的格伦线大楼。怡和洋行现在拥有罗斯福之家，这很可能是中国最大的酒窖和酒吧。

Park HotelHISTORIC BUILDING
历史建筑公园酒店

(国际饭店, Guójì Fàndiàn; map Google map; www.theparkhotelshanghai.com; 170 West Nanjing Rd, 南京西路170号; mPeople’s Square)
（ 国际饭店 ， Guójì Fàndiàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.theparkhotelshanghai.com; 南京西路南京西路 170 号 m 人民广场）

Designed by Hungarian architect Ladislaus Hudec and erected as a bank in 1934, the Park Hotel was Shanghai’s tallest building until the 1980s, when shoulder-padded architects first started squinting hopefully in the direction of Pudong. Back in the days when building height had a different meaning, it was said your hat would fall off if you looked at the roof.
百乐酒店由匈牙利建筑师拉迪斯劳斯·胡德克 （Ladislaus Hudec） 设计，于 1934 年作为银行建造，一直是上海最高的建筑，直到 1980 年代，垫肩的建筑师们第一次开始眯着眼睛望向浦东方向。在建筑高度有不同含义的时代，有人说如果你看屋顶，你的帽子就会掉下来。

Peruse the foyer for its art deco overture. A short walk east along Nanjing Rd is the Pacific Hotel map Google map (金门大酒店, Jīnmén Dàjiǔdiàn; %021 5352 9898; http://pacific.jinjianghotels.com; 108 West Nanjing Rd, 南京西路108号; d from ¥1000; aW), formerly the China United Apartment Building, also equipped with some lovely lobby details.
仔细阅读门厅的装饰艺术序曲。沿着南京路向东走一小段路就是太平洋酒店地图谷歌地图 （ 金门大酒店 ，Jīnmén Dàjiǔdiàn; % 021 5352 9898;http://pacific.jinjianghotels.com; 南京西路南京西路 108 号 ;d ¥1000 起; a W ）， 前身为华联公寓楼，也配备了一些可爱的大堂细节。

Gutzlaff Signal TowerTOWER
古茨拉夫信号塔 TOWER

(外滩信号台, Wàitān Xìnhào Tái; map Google map; 1 East Zhongshan No 2 Rd, 中山东二路1号; h10am-5pm; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 外滩信号台 ， Wàitān Xìnhào Tái; 地图谷歌地图 ;中山东二路东 1 号中山东二路 1 号 h 10am-5pm; m 南京东路）

This signal tower was built in 1907 to replace the wooden original as well as to serve as a meteorological relay station for the tireless Shanghai Jesuits. In the early 1950s it was commandeered as a river-boat police station, and in 1995 the entire edifice was shunted 22.4m to its present location.
这座信号塔建于 1907 年，旨在取代原来的木制信号塔，并作为不知疲倦的上海耶稣会士的气象中继站。1950 年代初期，它被征用为河船警察局，1995 年，整座建筑被分流到 22.4m 的现址。

People’s ParkPARK
人民公园 PARK

(人民公园, Rénmín Gōngyuán; map Google map; h6am-6pm, to 7pm Jul-Sep; mPeople’s Square)
（ 人民公园 ，Rénmín Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ; h 7 月至 9 月上午 6 点至下午 6 点至晚上 7 点; m 人民广场）

Occupying the site of the colonial racetrack (which became a holding camp during WWII), People’s Park is the city centre’s green refuge. It’s home to the Shanghai Museum of Contemporary Art, the Shanghai History Museum, pond-side bar Barbarossa and a small children’s fairground, and is overlooked by the towering form of Tomorrow Square map Google map (明天广场, Míngtiān Guǎngchǎng; 399 West Nanjing Rd, 南京西路399号), and the art deco classic Park Hotel.
人民公园占据了殖民时期赛马场（二战期间成为驻扎营地）的遗址，是市中心的绿色避难所。这里有上海当代艺术博物馆、 上海历史博物馆 、池畔酒吧 Barbarossa 和小型儿童游乐场，并俯瞰着高耸的明天广场地图 Google map（ 明天广场 ，Míngtiān Guǎngchǎng;南京西路 399 号， 南京西路 399 号 ） 和装饰艺术风格的经典公园酒店 。

From noon on Sundays (and some Saturdays) it’s the site of the Shanghai marriage market.
从周日（和一些周六）中午开始，这里就是上海婚嫁市场的所在地。

If you’re in Shanghai in June, join the photographers ringing the gorgeous pink lotuses that flower in the pond.
如果你在六月来上海，可以和摄影师一起欣赏池塘里绽放的绚丽的粉红色莲花。

Shanghai Museum of Contemporary ArtMUSEUM
上海当代美术馆 MUSEUM

(上海当代艺术馆, Shànghǎi Dāngdài Yìshùguǎn, MOCA Shanghai; map Google map; www.mocashanghai.org; People’s Park, 人民公园; adult/student ¥80/40; h10am-6pm; mPeople’s Square)
（ 上海当代艺术馆 ，Shànghǎi Dāngdài Yìshùguǎn，上海当代艺术馆; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.mocashanghai.org;人民公园; 成人/学生 ¥80/40; h 上午 10 点至下午 6 点; m 人民广场）

Nonprofit MOCA Shanghai has an all-glass home to maximise natural sunlight (when it cuts through the clouds), a tip-top location in People’s Park and a fresh approach to exhibiting contemporary artwork. Exhibits are temporary only; check the website to see what’s on – the shows can be underwhelming, so choose carefully. On the top floor is a light-filled restaurant and bar with a terrace; there’s a ¥20 discount for ticket holders.
非营利性上海当代艺术馆拥有全玻璃住宅，可最大限度地利用自然阳光（当阳光穿过云层时），位于人民公园的顶级位置，并以全新的方式展示当代艺术品。展品只是临时的;查看网站以了解正在播放的内容 - 这些节目可能平淡无奇，因此请谨慎选择。顶楼是一家光线充足的餐厅和酒吧，设有露台;持票者可享受 20 日元的折扣。

Shanghai Gallery of ArtGALLERY
上海美术馆 GALLERY

(外滩三号沪申画廊, Wàitān Sānhào Hùshēn Huàláng; map Google map; www.shanghaigalleryofart.com; 3rd fl, Three on the Bund, 3 East Zhongshan No1 Rd, 中山东一路三号三楼; h10am-7pm; mEast Nanjing Rd) F
（ 外滩三号沪申画廊 ， Wàitān Sānhào Hùshēn Huàláng; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.shanghaigalleryofart.com; 中山东一路三号外滩三楼， 中山东一路三号三楼 h 10am-7pm; m 南京东路） F

Take the lift up to the 3rd floor of Three on the Bund (外滩三号, Wàitān Sān Hào; map Google map; www.threeonthebund.com; 3 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd, 中山东一路3号; mEast Nanjing Rd) to this neat, minimalist art gallery showcasing current highbrow and conceptual Chinese art. It’s all bare concrete pillars, ventilation ducts and acres of wall space; there are a couple of divans on which you can sit and admire the works on view.
乘坐电梯到外滩三号 （ 外滩三号 ，Wàitān Sān Hào; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.threeonthebund.com;3 East Zhongshan No 1 Rd， 中山东一路 3 号 m East Nanjing Rd） 到这个整洁、简约的艺术画廊，展示当前的高雅和概念中国艺术。这里都是光秃秃的混凝土柱子、通风管道和数英亩的墙壁空间;有几张沙发，您可以坐在上面欣赏展出的作品。

Monument to the People’s HeroesMONUMENT
人民英雄纪念碑纪念碑

(人民英雄纪念碑, Rénmín Yīngxióng Jìniànbēi; map Google map; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 人民英雄纪念碑 ，Rénmín Yīngxióng Jìniànbēi; 地图谷歌地图 ; m 南京东路）

Up from Huangpu Park, this anachronistic monument stands above the Bund History Museum. Its socialist realism friezes depict the postwar triumphs of communism in Shanghai. Come here early in the morning for excellent photo ops as locals perform taichi to the backdrop of Pudong’s skyline.
从黄浦公园往上走，这座不合时宜的纪念碑矗立在外滩历史博物馆的上方。它的社会主义现实主义楣板描绘了战后共产主义在上海的胜利。清晨来到这里，享受绝佳的拍照机会，因为当地人在浦东天际线的背景下表演太极拳。

East Nanjing RoadAREA
南京东路 AREA

(南京东路, Nánjīng Dōnglù; map Google map; mEast Nanjing Rd)
（ 南京东路 ， Nánjīng Dōnglù; 地图谷歌地图 ; m 南京东路）

Linking the Bund with People’s Square is East Nanjing Rd, once known as Nanking Rd. The first department stores in China opened here in the 1920s, when the modern machine age – with its new products, automobiles, art deco styling and newfangled ideas – was ushered in. A glowing forest of neon at night, it’s no longer the cream of Shanghai shopping, but its pedestrian strip remains one of the most famous and crowded streets in China.
连接外滩和人民广场的是南京东路，曾被称为南京路。中国第一家百货公司于 1920 年代在这里开业，当时迎来了现代机器时代——新产品、汽车、装饰艺术风格和新奇的想法。夜晚霓虹灯闪闪发光的森林，它不再是上海购物的精华，但它的步行街仍然是中国最著名和最拥挤的街道之一。

Shanghai’s reputation as the country’s most fashionable city was forged in part here, through the new styles and trends introduced in department stores such as the Sun Sun (1926), today the Shanghai No 1 Food Store, and the Sun Company (1936), now the Shanghai No 1 Department Store (上海市第一百货商店, Shànghǎi Shì Dìyī Bǎihuò Shāngdiàn; map Google map; 800 East Nanjing Rd, 南京东路800号; h9.30am-10pm; mPeople’s Square, East Nanjing Rd). Today shops such as the vast Apple Store dominate the shopping landscape. Small ‘train’ tourist buses (¥5) roll from one pedestrianised end to the other.
上海作为全国最时尚城市的声誉部分是在这里形成的，这是通过百货公司引入的新风格和趋势，例如太阳太阳（1926 年），今天的上海第一食品店 ，以及太阳公司（1936 年），现在的上海第一百货商店（上海市第一百货商店 ，Shànghǎi Shì Dìyī Bǎihuò Shāngdiàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;南京东路南京东路 800 号 h 9.30am-10pm; m 南京东路人民广场）。 如今，像庞大的 Apple Store 商店这样的商店在购物领域占据主导地位。小型“火车”旅游巴士（5 日元）从步行街的一端滚动到另一端。

TOP TIPS
重要提示

A The Shanghai metro is fast, efficient, cheap, punctual and extensive.
上海 A 地铁快速、高效、便宜、准时、范围广泛。

A Taxis are widespread and great value for short hops.
A 出租车很普遍，对于短途旅行来说非常有价值。

A For budget accommodation, stick to Puxi, not Pudong.
A 对于经济型住宿，请坚持选择浦西，而不是浦东。

A If you only have a few days, see the Bund, People’s Square, the French Concession and Jing’an, with a foray to Pudong.
A 如果您只有几天的时间，可以参观外滩、人民广场、法租界和静安，然后前往浦东。

A Download a translation app to your phone and store the useful Shanghai Call Centre number for quick on-the-spot translations.
将翻译应用程序 A 下载到您的手机上，并存储有用的上海呼叫中心号码，以便快速进行现场翻译。

A Download a metro map app for quick reference and route planning around the city.
A 下载地铁地图应用程序，以便快速参考和规划城市周围的路线。

A Download a VPN before you arrive in China in order to access blocked websites (Facebook, Twitter, Google, Instagram etc).
在抵达中国之前 A 下载 VPN，以便访问被阻止的网站（Facebook、Twitter、Google、Instagram 等）。

1Shanghai Old City
1 上海老城区

oYuyuan Gardens & BazaarGARDENS, BAZAAR
o 豫园花园&市集 GARDENS， BAZAAR

(豫园、豫园商城, Yùyuán & Yùyuán Shāngchéng; map Google map; Anren St, 安仁街; high/low season ¥40/30; h8.30am-5.15pm, last entry 4.45pm; mYuyuan Garden)
（ 豫园、豫园商城 、Yùyuán & Yùyuán Shāngchéng; 地图谷歌地图 ;安仁街， 安仁街 ;旺/淡季 ¥40/30; h 上午 8：30 至下午 5：15，最后入场时间为下午 4：45; m 豫园）

With its shaded alcoves, glittering pools churning with fish, plus pavilions, pines sprouting wistfully from rockeries, and roving packs of Japanese tourists, the Yuyuan Gardens is one of Shanghai’s premier sights, but becomes overpoweringly crowded at weekends. The spring and summer blossoms bring a fragrant, floral aspect to the gardens, especially the luxurious petals of its Magnolia grandiflora, Shanghai’s flower. Other trees include the luohan pine, bristling with thick needles, plus willows, gingkos, cherry trees and magnificent dawn redwoods.
郁园拥有阴凉的壁龛、闪闪发光的鱼儿翻腾的水池、凉亭、假山上渴望发芽的松树和成群结队的日本游客，是上海首屈一指的景点之一，但在周末却变得非常拥挤。春夏的花朵为花园带来了芬芳的花香，尤其是上海的花卉玉兰的华丽花瓣。其他树木包括罗汉松，长满了粗针叶，还有柳树、银杏、樱花树和壮丽的黎明红杉。

The Pan family, rich Ming dynasty officials, founded these gardens, that took 18 years (1559–77) to be nurtured into existence before bombardment during the Opium War in 1842. The gardens took another trashing during French reprisals for attacks on their nearby concession during the Taiping Rebellion. Restored, they are a fine example of Ming garden design.
潘氏家族是明朝的富官，他们建立了这些花园，在 1842 年鸦片战争期间遭到轰炸之前，花了 18 年（1559-77 年）的时间才培育出来。在太平天国运动期间，法国对附近租界的袭击进行了报复，这些花园再次遭到破坏。经过修复，它们是明园设计的典范。

Next to the garden entrance is the Mid-Lake Pavilion Teahouse, once part of the gardens and now one of the most famous teahouses in China.
花园入口旁边是中湖亭茶馆 ，它曾经是花园的一部分，现在是中国最著名的茶馆之一。

The adjacent bazaar may be tacky, but it’s good for a browse if you can handle the push and pull of the crowds. The nearby Taoist Temple of the Town God is also worth visiting. Just outside the bazaar is Old Street, known more prosaically as Middle Fangbang Rd, a busy street lined with curio shops and teahouses.
相邻的集市可能很俗气，但如果你能处理人群的推拉，它对浏览有好处。附近的镇神道观也值得一游。集市外就是老街 ，更平淡地称为中方邦路，这是一条繁忙的街道，两旁林立着古玩店和茶馆。

Chenxiangge MonasteryBUDDHIST TEMPLE
陈香阁寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(沉香阁, Chénxiāng Gé; map Google map; 29 Chenxiangge Rd, 沉香阁路29号; ¥12; h7am-5pm; mYuyuan Garden)
（ 沉香阁 ， Chénxiāng Gé; 地图谷歌地图 ;沉香阁路 29 号， 沉香阁路 29 号 ; ¥12; h 上午 7 点至下午 5 点; m 豫园）

Sheltering a community of dark-brown-clothed monks from the Chenhai (Sea of Dust) – what Buddhists call the mortal world, but which could equally refer to Shanghai’s murky atmosphere – this lovely yellow-walled temple is a tranquil refuge. At the temple rear, the Guanyin Tower guides you upstairs to a glittering effigy of the malelooking goddess Guanyin, within a resplendent gilded cabinet.
这座可爱的黄墙寺庙为一群身穿深棕色衣服的僧侣从尘海（佛教徒所说的尘埃世界）中避难而过——这同样可以指上海的阴暗气氛——是一个宁静的避难所。在寺庙后面， 观音塔将带您上楼，在一个金碧辉煌的镀金柜子里，看到一个闪闪发光的男性女神观音像。

Carved from chénxiāng wood (Chinese eaglewood) and seated in lalitasana posture, head tilted and with one arm resting on her leg, this version is a modern copy; the original disappeared during the Cultural Revolution.
这个版本由中国鹰木（中国鹰木）雕刻而成，以拉利塔纳姿势坐着，头部倾斜，一只手臂搭在腿上，是现代复制品;原件在文革期间消失了。

At the front, the Hall of Heavenly Kings (天王殿, Tiānwáng Diàn) envelops four gilded Heavenly Kings (each belonging to a different compass point) and a slightly androgynous form of Maitreya. Muttered prayers and chanted hymns fill the Great Treasure Hall (大雄宝殿, Dàxióng Bǎodiàn), where a statue of Sakyamuni (Buddha) is flanked by two rows of nine luóhàn (arhats).
在前面， 天王殿 （ 天王殿 ，Tiānwáng Diàn）包裹着四位镀金天王（每个天王都属于不同的罗盘点）和一个略带雌雄同体的弥勒。大宝殿 （ 大雄宝殿 ，Dàxióng Bǎodiàn）充满了喃喃自语的祈祷和吟诵的赞美诗，那里有一尊释迦牟尼佛像，两排九罗汉 。

Temple of the Town GodTAOIST TEMPLE
镇神道教寺庙

(城隍庙, Chénghuáng Miào; map Google map; Yùyuán Bazaar, off Middle Fangbang Rd, 方浜中路豫园商城; ¥12; h8.30am-4.30pm; mYuyuan Garden)
（ 城隍庙 ，Chénghuáng Miào; 地图谷歌地图 ;Yùyuán Bazaar， 方浜中路豫园商城 Middle Fangbang Rd 旁 ;¥12; h 上午 8：30 至下午 4：30; m 豫园）

Chinese towns traditionally had a Taoist temple of the town god, but many fell victim to periodic upheaval. Originally dating from the early 15th century, this particular temple was badly damaged during the Cultural Revolution and later restored. Note the fine carvings on the roof as you enter the main hall, which is dedicated to Huo Guang, a Han dynasty general, flanked by rows of effigies representing both martial and civil virtues.
中国城镇传统上有一座镇神道教寺庙，但许多城镇都成为周期性动荡的牺牲品。这座特殊的寺庙最初可追溯至 15 世纪初，在文化大革命期间遭到严重破坏，后来进行了修复。当您进入正殿时，请注意屋顶上的精美雕刻，该殿殿供奉汉代将军霍光，两侧是一排排代表武德和文德的雕像。

Exit the hall north and peek into the multifaith hall on your right, which is dedicated to three female deities: Guanyin (Buddhist), Tianhou and Yanmu Niangniang (Taoist). Gazing fiercely over offerings of fruit from the rear Chengghuang Hall is the red-faced and bearded town god himself. Also note the Taisui Hall where worshippers pay respects to divine figures representing each year of the Chinese zodiac.
从大厅向北走，窥视右侧的多信仰大厅，这里供奉着三位女神：观音（佛教）、天后和燕木娘娘（道教）。从成皇殿后面凶狠地凝视着供奉的水果，是红脸大胡子的镇神本人。另请注意太岁堂 ，礼拜者在那里向代表中国十二生肖每年的神像致敬。

Fazangjiang TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
法藏江寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(法藏讲寺, Fǎzàngjiǎng Sì; 271 Ji’an Rd, 吉安路271号; suggested donation incl incense ¥5; h7.30am-4pm; mLaoximen)
吉安路 271 号， 建议捐款含香¥5; h 上午 7.30 至下午 4 点; m 老昔门）

This simple but very active temple is curiously accessed from the west, rather than the south, where the entrance to Buddhist temples usually lies. The restored main hall encloses a large modern statue of Sakyamuni, seated atop a lily between two walls glinting with gilded luóhàn.
奇怪的是，这座简单但非常活跃的寺庙是从西边进入的，而不是从南边进入的，那里通常是佛教寺庙的入口。修复后的正殿周围环绕着一尊大型现代释迦牟尼雕像，它坐在两面墙壁之间的百合花顶上，两面墙壁上闪闪发光，闪闪发光。

Other lesser halls shelter a trinity of golden Buddhist effigies and there’s a small shrine to the Buddhist god of the underworld, Dizang Wang. A handy vegetarian restaurant (open 9am to 9pm) is right next door for karmic sustenance.
其他较小的大厅供奉着三位一体的金色佛像，还有一座供奉冥界佛教神王地藏的小神殿。一家方便的素食餐厅（上午 9 点至晚上 9 点营业）就在隔壁，提供业力寄托。

SHANGHAI IN TWO DAYS
两天内上海

Day One
第一天

Follow the sweep of architectural pomp along the Bund before walking along the riverside promenade to view the Pudong skyline across the river. Art lovers can enjoy the Rockbund Art Museum, while architecture fans enjoy the highlights of Yuanmingyuan Road. Head west along East Nanjing Rd past shoppers to People’s Square.
沿着外滩的建筑盛况，沿着河滨长廊漫步，欣赏河对岸的浦东天际线。艺术爱好者可以欣赏上海外滩美术馆 ，而建筑爱好者则可以欣赏圆明园路的亮点。沿着南京东路向西行驶，经过购物者，到达人民广场 。

Immerse yourself in the collection of the Shanghai Museum before weighing up the Shanghai Urban Planning Exhibition Hall or discovering a pocket of greenery in People’s Park. For views, shoot up in the lift to the lobby of the JW Marriott on the 38th floor of Tomorrow Square.
沉浸在上海博物馆的藏品中，然后权衡上海城市规划展览馆或在人民公园发现一片绿色植物。要欣赏美景，可以乘坐电梯前往明日广场 38 层的 JW 万豪酒店大堂。

Hop on the metro (or a sightseeing bus) from People’s Square to Lujiazui to wander round the walkway in front of the Oriental Pearl TV Tower map Google map. Select between the observation towers of the Shanghai Tower map Google map, Jinmao Tower map Google map and the Shanghai World Financial Center map Google map, or settle for evening cocktails at Flair map Google map.
从人民广场搭乘地铁（或观光巴士）到陆家嘴，在东方明珠电视塔地图谷歌地图前的人行道上漫步。在上海中心大厦地图谷歌地图 、 金茂大厦地图谷歌地图和上海环球金融中心地图谷歌地图的观景塔之间进行选择，或者在 Flair 地图谷歌地图上享用晚间鸡尾酒。

Day Two
第二天

Peruse the architecture and boutiques of Xintiandi map Google map before watching artists at work at the Shanghai Arts & Crafts Museum or taking a seat to watch locals relaxing in French-designed Fuxing Park map Google map.
仔细阅读新天地地图的建筑和精品店 谷歌地图 在上海工艺美术馆观看艺术家的工作，或者坐下来观看当地人在法国设计的复兴公园地图 谷歌地图中放松。

Disappear among Tianzifang map Google map’s warren of lanes, then boutique window-shop around Tianzifang, take your hat off to the collection in the Propaganda Poster Art Centre map Google map, and hunt down contemporary art at Leo Gallery map Google map.
消失在天子坊地图谷歌地图的巷子里，然后在天子广场周围逛精品店，向宣传海报艺术中心地图谷歌地图中的收藏脱帽致敬，并在利奥画廊地图谷歌地图上寻找当代艺术。

1 法租界

oShanghai Museum of Public SecurityMUSEUM
o 上海公安博物馆 MUSEUM

(上海公安博物馆, Shànghǎi Gōng’ān Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %021 6472 0256; 518 South Ruijin Rd, 瑞金南路518号; h9am-4.30pm Mon-Sat, last entry 4pm; mDapuqiao) F
（ 上海公安博物馆 ，Shànghǎi Gōng'ān Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6472 0256;瑞金南路瑞金南路 518 h 号 周一至周六上午 9 时至下午 4 时 30 分，最后入场时间为下午 4 时; m 大埔桥） F

This offbeat and macabre museum details over three floors how the Chinese authorities keep control. Display cases depict the illicit activities local cops have encountered, the equipment police use to aid their work and the punishments given for such crimes. On display are tasers, lots of guns (one concealed in a violin case), seized gambling tables, restraining equipment, and a model-scale replica of the room in which war criminals were hung, among other eye-opening displays.
这座另类而令人毛骨悚然的博物馆在三层楼上详细介绍了中国当局如何保持控制。陈列柜描绘了当地警察遇到的非法活动、警察用来协助他们工作的设备以及对此类犯罪的惩罚。展出的有泰瑟枪、大量枪支（其中一把藏在小提琴盒中）、缴获的赌桌、约束设备以及悬挂战犯的房间的模型比例复制品，以及其他令人大开眼界的展示品。

There’s also a full-sized seized amphetamine lab. Meanwhile, there are cabinets with police uniforms from throughout the decades, plus the drones used for surveillance and iconic vintage police cars from the mid-20th century. There’s even a stuffed police dog. You need your passport to enter. Exhibition description boards are in Chinese only (bring a translation app).
还有一个全尺寸的缉获安非他明实验室。与此同时，还有装有几十年来警察制服的柜子，以及用于监视的无人机和 20 世纪中叶标志性的老式警车。甚至还有一只毛绒警犬。您需要护照才能入境。展会说明板仅提供中文（请携带翻译应用程序）。

oPropaganda Poster Art CentreGALLERY
o 宣传海报艺术中心 GALLERY

(宣传画年画艺术中心, Xuānchuánhuà Niánhuà Yìshù Zhōngxīn; map; %021 6211 1845; www.shanghaipropagandaart.com; Bldg B/4, President Mansion, 868 Huashan Rd, 华山路868号B-0C室; ¥25; h10am-5pm Tue-Sun; mShanghai Library)
（ 宣传画年画艺术中心 ， Xuānchuánhuà Niánhuà Yìshù Zhōngxīn; 地图 ; % 021 6211 1845;www.shanghaipropagandaart.com; 华山路 868 号 B-0C 室总统府 B/4 号楼 ;¥25; h 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 5 点; m 上海图书馆）

Design junkies and history buffs will love this vast collection of original posters from 1950s, ’60s and ’70s China, stored in the basement of a residential block. Many were produced in the golden age of Maoist poster production and are awash with iconic emblems of communism: red tractors, bumper harvests, muscled peasants and lantern-jawed proletarians. The exhibition rounds off with a collection of cigarette posters from the 1920s. There’s also a shop selling collector’s items including original and replica posters and postcards.
设计迷和历史爱好者一定会喜欢这大量来自 1950 年代、60 年代和 70 年代中国的原创海报，这些海报存放在住宅区的地下室。许多海报是在毛主义海报制作的黄金时代制作的，充斥着共产主义的标志性标志：红色拖拉机、丰收、肌肉发达的农民和灯笼般的无产者。展览以一系列 1920 年代的香烟海报结束。还有一家商店出售收藏品，包括原版和复制品海报和明信片。

Once you find the main entrance, a guard will pop a small business card with a map on it into your hands and point the way. Head around the back of the apartment blocks to Building B (or 4) and take the lift or stairs to the basement.
找到正门后，一名警卫会将一张印有地图的小名片交到你手中并指路。绕过公寓楼的后面前往 B 楼（或 4 号楼），然后乘坐电梯或楼梯到地下室。

oTianzifangAREA
o 天子坊地区

(田子坊, Tiánzǐfáng; map; Taikang Rd, 泰康路; mDapuqiao)
（ 田子坊 ， Tiánzǐfáng; 地图 ; 泰康路 m 大浦桥

Tianzifang and Xintiandi are based on a similar idea – an entertainment complex housed within a warren of lòngtáng (弄堂, alleyways). Unlike Xintiandi, families actually reside in Tianzifang and have done so for decades, meaning there’s a genuine charm, vibrancy and community. You do need to wade through the souvenir stalls to get to the good stuff, but this network of design studios, cafes, bars and boutiques is the perfect antidote to Shanghai’s oversized malls and intimidating skyscrapers.
天子坊和新天地基于类似的想法——一个位于弄堂（弄堂 ，小巷）内的娱乐中心。 与新天地不同的是，家庭实际上居住在天子坊，并且已经居住了几十年，这意味着这里有真正的魅力、活力和社区。你确实需要费力穿过纪念品摊位才能买到好东西，但这个由设计工作室、咖啡馆、酒吧和精品店组成的网络是上海超大购物中心和令人生畏的摩天大楼的完美解毒剂。

There are three main north–south lanes (Nos 210, 248 and 274) criss-crossed by irregular east–west alleyways, which makes exploration slightly disorienting and fun. The real activity is shopping, and the creative independent start-ups make for some interesting finds, from vintage spectacle frames at Shanghai Code map Google map (上海密码, Shànghǎi Mìmǎ; No 9, Lane 274, 274弄9号田子坊; h1-9pm) and crafted kid’s clothes at Chouchou Chic map Google map (喆缤豆小童生活馆, Zhébīndòu Xiǎotóng Shēnghuó Guǎn; www.chouchouchic.com; No 5, Lane 248, 248弄5号; h10am-9.30pm) to hand-wrapped pǔ’ěr teas from Zhenchalin. Elsewhere, a band of cool cafes, restaurants and bars, such as Kommune map Google map (公社, Gōngshè; %021 6466 2416; www.kommune.me; The Yard, No 7, Lane 210, 210弄7号田子坊; meals from ¥78; h9am-midnight; W) and Bell Bar map Google map (www.bellbar.cn; back door No 11, Lane 248, 248弄11号后门田子坊; h10am-2am; W), can sort out meals and drinks and help take the weight off your feet. Tianzifang can get hugely popular during weekends and holidays, when security may limit access to the lanes. The best time to visit is weekdays, preferably early in the morning or later in the evening. There’s a tourist information (h9am-4pm) centre at the entrance to Lane 210.
南北向的三条主车道（210、248、274 号）纵横交错，东西走向的巷道纵横交错，让探索略显迷失方向，充满乐趣。真正的活动是购物，富有创意的独立初创企业带来了一些有趣的发现，从上海代码地图的复古眼镜架谷歌地图 （ 上海密码 ，Shànghǎi Mìmǎ;No 9， Lane 274， 274 弄 9 号田子坊 h 1-9pm） 和 Chouchou Chic 地图的童装制作 Google map（ 喆缤豆小童生活馆 ， Zhébīndòu Xiǎotóng Shēnghuó Guǎn;www.chouchouchic.com;No 5， Lane 248， 248 弄 5 号 h 10am-9.30pm） 到来自 Zhenchalin 的手工包装 pǔ'ěr 茶。在其他地方，还有一群很酷的咖啡馆、餐馆和酒吧，例如 Kommune 地图 Google map（ 公社 ，Gōngshè; % 021 6466 2416;www.kommune.me;The Yard， No 7， Lane 210， 210 弄 7 号田子坊 ;餐食 78 日元起; h 上午 9 点至午夜; W ） 和 Bell Bar 地图 Google map（www.bellbar.cn; 后门 11 号， Lane 248， 248 弄 11 号后门田子坊 h 10am-2am; W ）， 可以整理膳食和饮料，帮助减轻脚上的重量。 天子坊在周末和节假日会非常受欢迎，因为安检可能会限制进入车道。最佳游览时间是工作日，最好是清晨或傍晚。210 巷入口处有一个旅游信息中心 （ h 上午 9 点至下午 4 点）。

oXintiandiAREA
o 新天地片区

(新天地, Xīntiāndì; map; www.xintiandi.com; 2 blocks btwn Taicang, Zizhong, Madang & South Huangpi Rds, 太仓路与马当路路口; mSouth Huangpi Rd, Xintiandi)
（ 新天地 ， Xīntiāndì; 地图 ;www.xintiandi.com;2 blocks btwn Taicang， Zizhong， Madang &; South Huangpi Rds， 太仓路与马当路口 m South Huangpi Rd， Xintiandi）

With its own namesake metro station, Xintiandi has been a Shanghai icon for over a decade. An upmarket entertainment and shopping complex modelled on traditional alleyway (lòngtáng) homes, this was the first development in the city to prove that historical architecture makes big commercial sense. Elsewhere that might sound like a no-brainer, but in 21st-century China, where bulldozers are always on standby, it came as quite a revelation.
新天地拥有自己的同名地铁站，十多年来一直是上海的标志。这是一个以传统小巷 （lòngtáng） 住宅为蓝本的高档娱乐和购物中心，这是该市第一个证明历史建筑具有巨大商业意义的开发项目。在其他地方，这听起来似乎是理所当然的，但在推土机始终待命的 21 世纪中国，这却是一个相当大的启示。

Well-heeled shoppers and alfresco diners keep things lively until late, and if you’re looking for a memorable meal or to browse through some of Shanghai’s more fashionable boutiques, you’re in the right spot. The heart of the complex, divided into a pedestrianised north and south block, consists of largely rebuilt traditional shíkùmén houses, brought bang up to date with a stylish modern spin. But while the layout suggests a flavour of yesteryear, you should not expect much in the cultural realm. Xintiandi doesn’t deliver any of the lived-in charms of Tianzifang or the creaking, rickety simplicity of Shanghai Old City. Beyond two worthwhile sights – the Shikumen Open House Museum and the Site of the 1st National Congress of the CCP map Google map (中共一大会址纪念馆, Zhōnggòng Yīdàhuìzhǐ Jìniànguǎn; Xintiandi North Block, 76 Xingye Rd, 兴业路76号; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun) F – it’s best for strolling the prettified alleyways and enjoying a summer evening over drinks or a meal.
富有的购物者和露天食客让活动热闹到深夜，如果您想吃一顿难忘的饭菜或浏览上海一些更时尚的精品店，那么您来对地方了。该建筑群的中心分为南北步行街区，由大部分重建的传统 shíkùmén 房屋组成，以时尚的现代风格与时俱进。但是，虽然布局暗示着过去的味道，但你不应该对文化领域抱有太大期望。新天地没有提供任何田子坊的居住魅力，也没有上海老城的吱吱作响、摇摇晃晃的简约。除了两个值得参观的景点——石库门开放日博物馆和中共第一次全国代表大会大会会址地图 Google map（ 中共一大会址纪念馆 ， Zhōnggòng Yīdàhuìzhǐ Jìniànguǎn;兴业路 76 号新天地北座， 兴业路 76 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点） F – 最适合漫步在美丽的小巷中，享受夏日的夜晚，喝酒或用餐。

Shanghai Arts and Crafts MuseumMUSEUM
上海工艺美术馆 MUSEUM

(上海工艺美术博物馆, Shànghǎi Gōngyì Měishù Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %021 6115 7072; 79 Fenyang Rd, 汾阳路79路; ¥8; h9am-5pm, last entry 4pm; mChangshu Rd)
（ 上海工艺美术博物馆 ， Shànghǎi Gōngyì Měishù Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6115 7072; 汾阳路 79 号， 汾阳路 79 路 ; ¥8; h 上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间为下午 4 点; m 常熟路）

Repositioned as a museum, this arts and crafts institute displays traditional crafts such as needlepoint embroidery, paper cutting, lacquer work, jade cutting and lantern making. Watch traditional crafts being executed live by craftspeople and admire the wonderful exhibits, from jade to ivory to inkstones and beyond. The 1905 building itself is a highlight, once serving as the residence for Chen Yi, Shanghai’s first mayor after the founding of the Chinese Communist Party.
这所工艺美术馆重新定位为博物馆，展示针绣、剪纸、漆器、玉石切割和灯笼制作等传统工艺品。观看工匠现场制作的传统工艺品，欣赏从玉石到象牙再到砚台等精彩展品。这座建于1905年的建筑本身就是一个亮点，曾经是中国共产党成立后上海第一任市长陈毅的住所。

After exploring the lovely garden, head up the steps to a host of splendid ivory and boxwood carvings on the 1st floor, where divine (Guanyin) and semidivine (Mao Zedong) beings are displayed; also look out for the exquisite ivory spider hanging from a web. Further displays include opera costumes and Shanghai dough modelling.
探索完美丽的花园后，沿着台阶前往一楼的许多华丽的象牙和黄杨木雕刻，那里展示了神（观音）和半神（毛泽东）的存在;还要留意挂在网上的精美象牙蜘蛛。其他展览包括戏曲服装和上海面团造型。

Xiangyang ParkPARK
襄阳公园 PARK

(襄阳公园; Xiāngyáng Gōngyuán; map Google map; 1008 Huaihai Middle Rd, near Xiangyang Rd, 淮海中路1008号近襄阳路; mSouth Shaanxi Rd) F
（ 襄阳公园 ;Xiāngyáng Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ;淮海中路 1008 号，近襄阳路， 淮海中路 1008 号近襄阳路 m South Shaanxi Rd） F

This small, French-inspired park features a central avenue lined with statuesque plane trees. Come evening, this walkway regularly transforms into a stage for lively dancing locals. Leafy trees, colourful flowerbeds and well-trimmed hedges fill the rest of the space, making for a scenic stroll away from the busy, neighbouring shopping highway. A short breather here will leave you feeling calm and recharged.
这座法国风格的小公园设有一条中央大道，两旁种满了雕像般的梧桐树。到了晚上，这条人行道经常变成当地人活泼跳舞的舞台。绿树成荫、色彩缤纷的花坛和修剪整齐的树篱填满了空间的其余部分，让您远离附近繁忙的购物高速公路，风景优美。在这里短暂的喘息会让您感到平静和充电。

BeaugesteGALLERY
博格斯特画廊

(比极影像, Bǐjí Yǐngxiàng; map; %021 6466 9012; www.beaugeste-gallery.com; Tianzifang, 5th fl, No 5, Lane 210, Taikang Rd, 泰康路210弄5号520室田子坊; h10am-6pm Sat & Sun; mDapuqiao) F
（ 比极影像 ，Bǐjí Yǐngxiàng; 地图 ; % 021 6466 9012;www.beaugeste-gallery.com;田子坊， 泰康路 210 弄 5 号 5 号 5 室田子坊 h 周六及周日上午 10 时至下午 6 时; m 大埔桥） F

One of Shanghai’s top galleries, this small space is concealed high above the street-level crowds. Curator Jean Loh captures humanistic themes in contemporary Chinese photography, and his wide range of contacts and excellent eye ensure exhibits are always both moving and thought provoking. Note that during the week the gallery is open by appointment only.
作为上海顶级画廊之一，这个狭小的空间隐藏在街道人群之上。策展人 Jean Loh 捕捉中国当代摄影中的人文主题，他广泛的接触和出色的眼光确保展品总是既感人又发人深省。请注意，在一周内，画廊仅通过预约开放。

Ba Jin’s Former ResidenceHISTORIC BUILDING
巴金故居历史建筑

(巴金故居, Bājīn Gùjū; map Google map; 113 Wukang Rd, 武康路113号; h10am-4.30pm Tue-Sun; mShanghai Library) F
（ 巴金故居 ，Bājīn Gùjū; 地图谷歌地图 ; 武康路武康路 113 h 号 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 4 点 30 分; m 上海图书馆） F

This charming little pebble-dash residence with a delightful garden is where the acclaimed author Ba Jin (1904–2005) lived from 1955 to the mid-1990s. Ba was the author of dozens of novels and short stories (including Random Thoughts and Family, which later influenced Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen). His house today contains a collection of old photos, books and manuscripts.
这座迷人的鹅卵石小住宅和一个令人愉悦的花园，是著名作家巴金（1904-2005）在 1955 年至 1990 年代中期居住的地方。巴是数十部小说和短篇小说的作者（包括后来影响挪威剧作家亨利克·易卜生的《 随机思想 》和《家庭》）。今天，他的房子里收藏着一系列旧照片、书籍和手稿。

Many of his works were published during the peak of his career in the 1930s. Like many intellectuals, he was persecuted mercilessly during the Cultural Revolution, during which time his wife died after being denied medical treatment. A fingerprint is needed for entry.
他的许多作品都是在 1930 年代他职业生涯的巅峰时期出版的。和许多知识分子一样，他在文化大革命期间受到无情的迫害，在此期间，他的妻子因被拒绝就医而去世。进入需要指纹。

Shikumen Open House MuseumMUSEUM
石库门开放日博物馆 MUSEUM

(石库门屋里厢, Shíkùmén Wūlǐxiāng; map Google map; Xintiandi North Block, Bldg 25, 太仓路181弄25号楼新天地北里; adult/child ¥20/10; h10am-10pm; mSouth Huangpi Rd, Xintiandi)
（ 石库门屋里厢 ， Shíkùmén Wūlǐxiāng; 地图谷歌地图 ;新天地北座 25 号楼， 太仓路 181 弄 25 号楼新天地北里 ;成人/儿童 20/10 日元; h 上午 10 点至晚上 10 点; m 新天地黄陂南路）

This two-floor exhibition invites you into a typical shíkùmén (stone-gate house) household, decked out with period furniture. The ground-floor arrangement contains a courtyard, entrance hall, bedroom, study and lounge. There’s a small kitchen to the rear and natural illumination spills down from tiānjǐng (light wells) above. The small, north-facing wedge-shaped tíngzijiān (pavilion) room on the landing, almost at the top of the stairs between the 1st and 2nd floors, was a common feature of shíkùmén, and was often rented out.
这个两层楼的展览邀请您进入一个典型的石门房屋，里面装饰着仿古家具。底层布置包括庭院、入口大厅、卧室、书房和休息室。后面有一个小厨房，自然光从上面的 tiānjǐng（光井）洒下来。平台上朝北的小楔形亭子间 ，几乎位于一楼和二楼之间的楼梯顶部，是 shikùmén 的共同特征，经常出租。

The main bedrooms are all on the 2nd floor, linked together by doors, and there is an exhibition room displaying artworks depicting daily life in those days.
主卧室均位于二楼，由门连接在一起，并设有展示室，展示着描绘当时日常生活的艺术品。

Fuxing ParkPARK
复兴公园 PARK

(复兴公园, Fùxīng Gōngyuán; map; h6am-6pm; mSouth Huangpi Rd, Xintiandi)
（ 复兴公园 ， Fùxīng Gōngyuán; 地图 ; h 早上 6 点至下午 6 点; m 新天地黄陂南路）

This leafy spot with a large lawn, laid out by the French in 1909 and used by the Japanese as a parade ground in the late 1930s, remains one of the city’s more enticing parks. There is always plenty to see here: the park is a refuge for the elderly and a practising field for itinerant musicians, chess players, people walking backwards and slow-moving taichi types.
这个绿树成荫的地方有大片草坪，由法国人于 1909 年布置，并在 1930 年代后期被日本人用作阅兵场，至今仍是该市最具吸引力的公园之一。这里总是有很多值得一看的地方：公园是老年人的避难所，也是流动音乐家、棋手、倒着走的人和行动缓慢的太极拳类型的练习场。

Heavily shaded by big-leafed wutong trees, it’s a choice place to take a seat and escape the summer sun; there’s even a popular kids’ playground. Impassive to the laughter of children, the huge stony-faced busts of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels gaze out from a seemingly redundant epoch, and nobody seems to notice. The park stays open later during the summer months.
这里被大叶梧桐树遮荫，是坐下来躲避夏日阳光的首选之地;甚至还有一个受欢迎的儿童游乐场。卡尔·马克思和弗里德里希·恩格斯的巨大石脸半身像对孩子们的笑声无动于衷，从一个看似多余的时代凝视着外面，似乎没有人注意到。公园在夏季开放较晚。

Sun Yatsen’s Former ResidenceHISTORIC BUILDING
孙中山故居历史建筑

(孙中山故居, Sūn Zhōngshān Gùjū; map Google map; %021 6385 8283; 7 Xiangshan Rd, 香山路7号; adult ¥20, child, student & senior ¥10; h9am-4.30pm Tue-Sun; mSouth Shaanxi Rd, Xintiandi)
（ 孙中山故居 ，Sūn Zhōngshān Gùjū; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6385 8283; 香山路香山路 7 号 ;成人 20 元，儿童、学生、长者 10 元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4.30; m 新天地陕西南路）

Sun Zhongshan predictably receives the full-on hagiographic treatment at this shrine to China’s guófù (国父, father of the nation). A capacious exhibition hall next door has more than 150 cultural items on exhibit exalting his memory and serves as a full-on prelude to his pebble-dash ‘Spanish-style’ home. There’s a free audio guide if you leave your driving licence or passport for a deposit.
不出所料，孙中山在这座供奉中国国父的圣地接受了全面的圣徒传记待遇。 隔壁一个宽敞的展厅展出了 150 多件文化物品，唤起了他的记忆，也是他鹅卵石破折号“西班牙风格”住宅的完整前奏。如果您留下驾驶执照或护照以支付押金，则有免费的语音导览。

Once you get to his house proper – where he lived on what was rue Moliere from 1918 to 1924 – you need to pop transparent shower caps over your shoes to protect the threadbare carpets. Don’t forget to catch the lovely garden, where a Magnolia grandiflora flowers deliciously in summer.
一旦你到达他的房子——他从 1918 年到 1924 年住在莫里哀街——你需要在鞋子上戴上透明浴帽，以保护破旧的地毯。别忘了去美丽的花园，夏天， 玉兰花盛开。

Soong Qingling’s Former ResidenceHISTORIC BUILDING
宋庆龄故居历史建筑

(宋庆龄故居, Sōng Qìnglíng Gùjū; map Google map; %021 6474 7183; www.shsoong-chingling.com; 1843 Middle Huaihai Rd, 淮海中路1843号; adult/child ¥20/10; h9am-4.30pm; mJiaotong University)
（ 宋庆龄故居 ，Sōng Qìnglíng Gùjū; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6474 7183;www.shsoong-chingling.com;淮海中路淮海中路 1843 号 ;成人/儿童 20/10 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 4.30; m 交通大学）

Built in the 1920s by a Greek shipping magnate, this quiet building became home to Soong Qingling, wife of Dr Sun Yatsen, from 1948 to 1963. Size up two of her black limousines (one a gift from Stalin) in the garage and pad about the house, conjuring up sensations of yesteryear from its period furnishings. The highlight is the gorgeous garden, with tall magnolias and camphor trees towering over a delightful lawn, where Song entertained guests with conversation and tea.
这座安静的建筑由一位希腊航运巨头于 1920 年代建造，1948 年至 1963 年间成为孙中山博士的妻子宋庆龄的家。在车库里给她的两辆黑色豪华轿车（一辆是斯大林的礼物）放上尺寸，在房子周围垫着，从它的仿古家具中唤起过去的感觉。亮点是华丽的花园，高大的玉兰和樟树耸立在宜人的草坪上，宋用谈话和茶来招待客人。

A few personal belongings are also on display in the house, including autographed books from American journalists Edgar Snow and Agnes Smedley, and a collection of old photographs depicting the Soong sisters and various heads of state.
房子里还陈列着一些个人物品，包括美国记者埃德加·斯诺和艾格尼丝·史沫特莱的亲笔签名书籍，以及描绘宋氏姐妹和多位国家元首的老照片集。

Leo GalleryGALLERY
青少狮画廊 GALLERY

(狮语画廊, Shīyǔ Huàláng; map; %021 5465 8785; www.leogallery.com.cn; 376 Wukang Rd, 武康路376号; h11am-7pm Tue-Sun; mShanghai Library, Jiaotong University) F
（ 狮语画廊 ，Shīyǔ Huàláng; 地图 ; % 021 5465 8785;www.leogallery.com.cn;武康路武康路 376 号 h 周二至周日上午 11 点至晚上 7 点; m 上海交通大学附属图书馆） F

Spread across two buildings in the charming Ferguson Lane complex (武康庭, Wǔkāng Tíng; www.fergusonlane.com.cn; 378 Wukang Rd, 武康路378号), the Leo Gallery focuses on works by young Chinese artists.
分布在迷人的弗格森巷综合体 （ 武康庭 ，Wǔkāng Tíng;www.fergusonlane.com.cn; 武康路 378 号武康路 378 号 ）， 青狮画廊专注于中国年轻艺术家的作品。

Chinese Printed Blue Nankeen Exhibition HallMUSEUM
中国印花蓝南肯展览馆 MUSEUM

(中国蓝印花布馆, Zhōngguó Lán Yìnhuābù Guǎn; map Google map; %021 5403 7947; No 24, Lane 637, Changle Rd, 长乐路637弄24号; h9am-5.30pm; mChangshu Rd) F
（ 中国蓝印花布馆 ， Zhōngguó Lán Yìnhuābù Guǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 5403 7947;长乐路 637 弄 24 号 长乐路 637 弄 24 号 h 9am-5.30pm; m 常熟路） F

Head down the lane and through courtyards until you see blue cloth drying in the yard. Originally produced in Jiangsu, Zhejiang and Guizhou provinces, this blue-and-white cotton fabric (sometimes called blue calico) is similar to batik, and is coloured using a starch-resist method and indigo dye bath. This museum and shop display and sell items made by hand, from the cloth right down to the buttons.
沿着小巷穿过庭院，直到看到院子里晾干的蓝布。这种蓝白棉织物（有时称为蓝印花布）最初产于江苏、浙江和贵州省，类似于蜡染，采用淀粉抗蚀剂方法和靛蓝染浴着色。这个博物馆和商店展示和销售手工制作的物品，从布料到纽扣。

Started by Japanese artist Kubo Mase, it has been in business for decades, takes pride in quality and does not give discounts. Wind through the alleys to find it. Local residents will point you in the right direction if you show them the Chinese address.
由日本艺术家久保间濑创立，经营数十年，以质量为荣，不打折。蜿蜒穿过小巷才能找到它。如果您向当地居民展示中国地址，他们会为您指明正确的方向。

CONTEMPORARY & MODERN ART
当代和现代艺术

Notable contemporary Shanghainese artists working across a large spectrum of styles include Pujie, with his colourful pop-art depictions of Shanghai, video-installation artists Shi Yong and Hu Jieming, and Hangzhou-born Sun Liang. Wu Yiming creates calmer, more impressionistic works, while Ding Yi is a significant abstract artist whose works employ a repetitive use of crosses. Also look out for works by graphic-design artist Guan Chun, and the diverse works of Chen Hangfeng and Yang Yongliang, which draw inspiration from the techniques and imagery of traditional Chinese painting.
著名的上海当代艺术家的作品风格多种多样，包括普杰，他以丰富多彩的波普艺术描绘了上海，录像装置艺术家石勇和胡介明，以及出生于杭州的孙亮。吴一鸣创作的作品更平静、更印象派，而丁一则是一位重要的抽象艺术家，他的作品重复使用十字架。此外，还要留意平面设计艺术家关淳的作品，以及陈航峰和杨永亮的多样化作品，这些作品从中国传统绘画的技法和意象中汲取灵感。

1Jing’an
1 静安

oJade Buddha TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 玉佛寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(玉佛寺, Yùfó Sì; map Google map; cnr Anyuan & Jiangning Rds, 安远路和江宁路街口; ¥20; h8am-4.30pm; mChangshou Rd)
（ 玉佛寺 ，Yùfó Sì; 地图谷歌地图 ;安远路和江宁路交叉路口， 安远路和江宁路街口 ; ¥20; h 上午 8 点至下午 4.30; m 长寿路）

One of Shanghai’s few active Buddhist monasteries, this temple was built between 1918 and 1928. The highlight is a transcendent Buddha crafted from pure jade, one of five shipped back to China by the monk Hui Gen at the turn of the 20th century. It’s a popular stopover for tour buses, so be prepared for crowds. During the Lunar New Year (usually February), the temple is very busy, as some 20,000 Chinese Buddhists throng to pray for prosperity.
这座寺庙是上海为数不多的活跃佛教寺院之一，建于 1918 年至 1928 年间。亮点是一尊由纯玉制成的超凡佛像，这是 20 世纪之交僧人惠根运回中国的五尊佛像之一。这里是旅游巴士的热门中转站，因此请做好人群的准备。农历新年（通常是二月）期间，寺庙非常繁忙，大约 20,000 名中国佛教徒蜂拥而至祈求繁荣昌盛。

The first temple on your immediate left upon entering is the Hall of Heavenly Kings, holding the statues of the Four Heavenly Kings who look upon the four cardinal points. Directly opposite is the twin-eaved Grand Hall, the temple’s most significant building, where worshippers pray to the past, present and future Buddhas. Also within the Grand Hall are splendidly carved luóhàn (arhats), lashed to the walls with wires, and a copper-coloured statue of Guanyin at the rear. Passing through the Grand Hall you’ll reach a gated tranquil courtyard, where stairs lead up to the Jade Buddha Hall. The absolute centrepiece of the temple is the 1.9m-high pale-green jade Buddha, seated upstairs and carved from one piece. Photographs are not permitted. Further into the complex is the Reclining Budda Hall, which contains a small reclining white jade Buddha from Burma that’s displayed in a glass cabinet. The Mahavira Hall was renovated and reopened in 2019; it was raised by a metre and now stands at 18.2m tall and weighs in at 1000 tonnes.
进入左边的第一座寺庙是天王殿 ，里面有四大天王的雕像，他们俯瞰着四个基点。正对面是双檐大殿 ，这是寺庙最重要的建筑，信徒们在这里向过去、现在和未来的佛陀祈祷。大殿内还有雕刻精美的罗汉 （罗汉），用铁丝绑在墙上，后面有一尊铜色的观音像。穿过大礼堂，您将到达一个带门的宁静庭院，那里的楼梯通向玉佛殿 。寺庙的绝对中心是 1.9 米高的淡绿色玉佛，它坐在楼上，由一体雕刻而成。不允许拍照。再往里走就是卧佛殿 ，里面有一尊来自缅甸的白色玉小佛，陈列在玻璃柜里。 摩诃毗罗殿于 2019 年翻新并重新开放;它被抬高了一米，现在高 18.2 米，重 1000 吨。

To get here, take either Changshou metro station exit 5 and walk along Anyuan Rd, or get off at Jiangning Rd metro and walk south along Jiangning Rd. There’s a vegetarian restaurant within the temple complex.
前往这里，从长寿地铁站 5 号出口沿安源路步行，或在江宁路地铁下车，沿江宁路向南步行。寺庙建筑群内有一家素食餐厅 。

oM50ARTS CENTRE
o M50 艺术中心

(M50创意产业集聚区, M50 Chuàngyì Chǎnyè Jíjùqū; map Google map; 50 Moganshan Rd, 莫干山路50号; mJiangning Rd) F
（M50 创意产业集聚区 ， M50 Chuàngyì Chǎnyè Jíjùqū; 地图谷歌地图 ;莫干山路 50 号莫干山路 50 号 m 江宁路） F

Shanghai may be known for its glitz and glamour, but it’s got an edgy subculture too. The industrial M50 art complex is one prime example, where galleries have set up in disused factories and cotton mills, utilising the vast space to showcase emerging and established contemporary artists. There’s a lot to see, so plan to spend half a day poking around the site.
上海可能以其浮华和魅力而闻名，但它也有前卫的亚文化。工业 M50 艺术中心就是一个典型的例子，画廊在废弃的工厂和棉纺厂设立，利用广阔的空间展示新兴和成熟的当代艺术家。有很多值得一看的地方，所以计划花半天时间在网站上逛逛。

The most established galleries here include ShanghART with a big, dramatic space showcasing the work of some of the dozens of artists it represents. The forward-thinking, provocative and downright entertaining island6 focuses on collaborative works created in a studio behind the gallery. Budding photographers should absolutely pop into DN Club map Google map (当年, Dāngnián; %021 6276 9657; Room 107, Bldg 17, M50创意产业17号楼107室; 3hr course ¥880; h10am-6pm Tue-Sun), with its classes using vintage SLRs and a dark room for developing prints.
这里最成熟的画廊包括香格纳艺术中心 ，拥有一个宽敞而引人注目的空间，展示了它所代表的数十位艺术家中的一些艺术家的作品。具有前瞻性、挑衅性和彻头彻尾的娱乐性岛 6 专注于在画廊后面的工作室创作的合作作品。崭露头角的摄影师绝对应该进入 DN 俱乐部地图 谷歌地图 （ 当年 ， Dāngnián; % 021 6276 9657;M50 创意产业 17 号楼 107 室 ;3 小时课程 ¥880; h 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 6 点）， 其课程使用老式单反相机和用于冲洗照片的暗室。

Most galleries are open from 10am to 6pm, with the majority closed Mondays.
大多数画廊的开放时间为上午 10 点至下午 6 点，大多数周一关闭。

oJing’an TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 静安寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(静安寺, Jìng’ān Sì; map Google map; 1686-1688 West Nanjing Rd, 南京西路1686-1688号; ¥50; h7.30am-5pm; mJing’an Temple)
（ 静安寺 ，Jìng'ān Sì; 地图谷歌地图 ;南京西路南京西路 1686-1688 号 ;¥50; h 上午 7.30 至下午 5 点; m 静安寺）

With the original temple dating back to AD 1216, the much-restored Jing’an Temple was here well before all the audacious skyscrapers and glitzy shopping malls. Today it stands like a shimmering mirage in defiance of West Nanjing Rd’s soaring modern architecture: a sacred portal to the Buddhist world that partially, at least, underpins this metropolis of 24 million souls.
最初的寺庙可以追溯到公元 1216 年，经过精心修复的静安寺远早于所有大胆的摩天大楼和耀眼的购物中心。今天，它就像一座闪闪发光的海市蜃楼，蔑视南京西路高耸的现代建筑：通往佛教世界的神圣门户，至少部分支撑着这座拥有 2400 万灵魂的大都市。

While the tinkle of wind chimes and burning of incense can’t compete with the blaring horns outside, the temple still emits an air of reverence.
虽然风铃的叮当声和焚香的声响无法与外面的鸣笛声相抗衡，但寺庙仍然散发着崇敬的气息。

Constructed largely of Burmese teak, the temple has some impressive statues, including a massive 8.8m-high, 15-tonne silver Buddha in the main Mahavira Hall with 46 pillars; a 3.87m-high Burmese white-jade Sakyamuni in the side halls; and a five-tonne Guanyin statue in the Guanyin Hall, carved from a 1000-year-old camphor tree. It still rattles away to the sounds of construction, while in the bunker beneath the main hall is an unfinished space housing 18 glittering luóhàn and little else. The complex has been designed to incorporate shops and restaurants around its perimeter – including a fantastic vegetarian restaurant – which stretches around the block, and the metro runs right underneath. The ¥50 admission charge is steep, however, for such a modest and thoroughly modern place of worship.
这座寺庙主要由缅甸柚木建造，有一些令人印象深刻的雕像，包括主大摩诃毗罗殿中一尊高 8.8 米、重 15 吨的巨大银佛，有 46 根柱子;侧殿有高 3.87 米的缅甸白玉释迦牟尼;观音堂内有一尊重达五吨的观音像，由一棵千年树龄的樟树雕刻而成。它仍然在施工的声音中嘎嘎作响，而在主厅下方的掩体中，有一个未完工的空间，里面有 18 个闪闪发光的 luóhàn，除此之外什么都没有。该综合体的设计包括其周边的商店和餐馆——包括一家很棒的素食餐厅 ——它围绕着街区延伸，地铁就在下面运行。然而，对于这样一个朴素而完全现代化的礼拜场所来说，50 日元的入场费是高昂的。

Khi Vehdu, who ran Jing’an Temple in the 1930s, was one of the most remarkable figures of the time. The nearly 2m-tall abbot had a large following as well as seven concubines, each of whom had a house and a car. During the Cultural Revolution, the temple was stripped of its Buddhist statues and transformed into a plastics factory before burning to the ground in 1972.
在 1930 年代经营静安寺的 Khi Vehdu 是当时最杰出的人物之一。这位近 2 米高的方丈拥有众多追随者，还有七位妃子，每人都有房子和汽车。文化大革命期间，这座寺庙的佛像被拆除，改造成塑料厂，然后于 1972 年被烧毁。

Good times to visit include the Festival of Bathing Buddha (on the eighth day of the fourth lunar month) and at the full moon.
游览的好时间包括浴佛节（农历四月八）和满月。

oShanghai Natural History MuseumMUSEUM
o 上海自然博物馆 MUSEUM

(上海自然博物馆, Shànghǎi Zìrán Bówùguǎn; %021 6862 2000; www.snhm.org.cn; 510 West Beijing Rd, 北京西路510号; adult/teen/child ¥30/12/free; h9am-5.15pm Tue-Sun; mShanghai Natural History Museum)
（ 上海自然博物馆 ，Shànghǎi Zìrán Bówùguǎn; % 021 6862 2000;www.snhm.org.cn;北京西路西北京路 510 号 ;成人/青少年/儿童 30 元/12 元/免费; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点 15 分; m 上海自然博物馆）

It’s not quite on the same scale as Washington, DC’s Smithsonian, but this sleek space is nevertheless as comprehensive as it is entertaining and informative. The museum is packed with displays of taxidermied animals, dinosaurs and cool interactive features. Its architecture is also a highlight, with a striking design that is beautifully integrated into its art-filled Jing’an Sculpture Park setting.
它的规模与华盛顿特区的史密森尼博物馆并不完全相同，但这个时尚的空间仍然既全面又有趣且信息丰富。博物馆里摆满了动物标本、恐龙的展示和很酷的互动功能。它的建筑也是一大亮点，其引人注目的设计完美地融入了充满艺术气息的静安雕塑公园环境。

Spread over five levels, life-size creatures are the focal point throughout, with taxidermied (mostly realistic) animals, birds and reptiles, and models of soaring marine animals hanging spectacularly from the top floor. Exhibitions span diverse ecologies, humankind and geology, the treasures of earth and the way of evolution.
分布在五层楼上，真人大小的生物是贯穿始终的焦点，标本剥制（大部分是逼真的）动物、鸟类和爬行动物，以及壮观地悬挂在顶层的翱翔海洋动物模型。展览涵盖多元生态、人与地质、地球宝藏、进化之道。

Dinosaur fossils are well represented (including the indigenous Yunnanese ‘Lufeng lizard’); these are interspersed with impressive life-like mechanical dinosaurs that move and roar.
恐龙化石有很好的代表性（包括云南本土的“陆丰蜥蜴”）;这些恐龙中穿插着令人印象深刻的栩栩如生的机械恐龙，它们会移动和咆哮。

The building’s exterior spirals like a nautilus shell topped by a curved lawn embankment, Chinese-inspired water garden and vertical garden wall. Within, the main architectural feature is a 30m-high glass atrium, with a conical molecular-shaped glass ‘cell wall’ that floods the building with natural light. Symbolic of the living organisms within, its transparent core holds a tranquil courtyard garden with a pond full of plants, trickling waterfalls and rocky outcrops.
该建筑的外部螺旋形如鹦鹉螺壳，顶部有弯曲的草坪堤岸、中国风格的水上花园和垂直的花园墙。内部的主要建筑特色是一个 30 米高的玻璃中庭，带有圆锥形分子形玻璃“细胞墙”，使自然光充满建筑。它象征着里面的生物体，其透明的核心是一个宁静的庭院花园，里面有一个充满植物的池塘、涓涓细流的瀑布和岩石露头。

oisland6GALLERY
o island6 画廊

(六岛, Liù Dǎo; map Google map; %021 6227 7856; www.island6.org; 2nd fl, Bldg 6, 50 Moganshan Rd, 莫干山路50号6号楼; h10am-6pm; mJiangning Rd)
（ 六岛 ，Liù Dǎo; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6227 7856;www.island6.org;莫干山路 50 号 6 号楼 6 号楼 2 楼 ， 莫干山路 50 号 6 号楼 h 10am-6pm; m 江宁路）

One of the M50 art precinct’s most creative, thought-provoking, interactive and engaging galleries is island6. Artist Liu Dao showcases his work and that of a collective of painters, writers and multimedia artists who present pieces with moving LED lights, 2D wall hangings with integrated video, and countless retro and iconic graphics with futuristic features.
M50 艺术区最具创意、发人深省、互动性和吸引力的画廊之一是 island6。艺术家刘导展示了他以及一群画家、作家和多媒体艺术家的作品，他们展示了带有移动 LED 灯、带有集成视频的 2D 壁挂以及无数具有未来主义特征的复古和标志性图形的作品。

Jing’an Sculpture ParkSCULPTURE, GARDEN
静安雕塑公园雕塑、花园

(静安雕塑公园, Jìng’ān Diāosù Gōngyuán; 128 Shimen No 2 Rd, 石门二路128号; h6am-8.30pm; mWest Nanjing Rd, Shanghai Natural History Museum) F
（ 静安雕塑公园 ， Jìng'ān Diāosù Gōngyuán; 128 Shimen No 2 Rd， 石门二路 128 号 h 6am-8.30pm; m 南京西路，上海自然博物馆） F

The attractive Jing’an Sculpture Park contains a mix of permanent and temporary pieces created by mainly international artists. The sculptures are carefully scattered, making it a wonderful place to stroll and browse the abstract, thought-provoking works, dabbled with absurdity and humour. You’ll find everything from red metal trees and metal cows grazing on the grass to a pyramid of cellos and ostriches with their heads buried in the ground. In April the blossoming cherry trees are an attractive sight.
迷人的静安雕塑公园包含主要由国际艺术家创作的永久和临时作品。雕塑被精心散布，使其成为漫步和浏览抽象、发人深省的作品、涉足荒谬和幽默的绝妙场所。您会发现从红色金属树和在草地上吃草的金属牛到大提琴和鸵鸟的金字塔，头埋在地下。四月，盛开的樱花树是一道迷人的风景线。

The impressive Shanghai Natural History Museum is also located here.
令人印象深刻的上海自然博物馆也位于这里。

Shanghai Exhibition CentreARCHITECTURE
上海展览中心建筑

(上海展览中心, Shànghǎi Zhǎnlǎn Zhōngxīn; map Google map; 1000 Middle Yan’an Rd, 延安中路1000号; mJing’an Temple) F
（ 上海展览中心 ， Shànghǎi Zhǎnlǎn Zhōngxīn; 地图谷歌地图 ; 延安中路 1000 号 m 延安寺 F 中路）

The hulking monolith of the Shanghai Exhibition Centre was built in 1955 as the Sino-Soviet Friendship Mansion – a friendship that soon turned sour and even regressed to the brink of war in the 1960s. The Stalinist-style architecture is based on St Petersberg’s Admiralty Building, with neoclassical columns and a skeletal spire topped by a communist red star. The best view of it is from Yan’an Rd, where it’s fronted by a stirring bronze socialist-realist monument and red-star stained-glass windows.
上海展览中心的巨石建于 1955 年，当时名为中苏友谊府——这种友谊很快就变质，甚至在 1960 年代倒退到战争的边缘。斯大林主义风格的建筑以圣彼得堡的海军部大厦为基础，拥有新古典主义的柱子和顶层顶着共产主义红星的骨架尖顶。从延安路可以看到它的最佳景观，那里有一座令人振奋的青铜社会主义现实主义纪念碑和红星彩色玻璃窗。

The site of the Exhibition Centre was originally the gardens of Jewish millionaire Silas Hardoon. You’re allowed to wander its grounds and photograph the buildings. Architecture lovers will appreciate its monumentality and bold, unsubtle Bolshevik strokes. There was a time when Pudong was set to look like this.
展览中心的所在地最初是犹太百万富翁塞拉斯·哈杜恩的花园。您可以在其场地漫步并拍摄建筑物。建筑爱好者会欣赏它的纪念碑性和大胆、不微妙的布尔什维克笔触。曾经有一段时间，浦东被设定成这个样子。

ShanghARTGALLERY
香格纳艺术画廊

(香格纳画廊, Xiānggénà Huàláng; map Google map; %021 6359 3923; www.shanghartgallery.com; Bldg 16 & 18, 50 Moganshan Rd, M50创意产业16, 18号楼; h10am-6pm Tue-Thu, 10.30am-6.30pm Fri-Sun; mJiangning Rd) F
（ 香格纳画廊 ，Xiānggénà Huàláng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6359 3923;www.shanghartgallery.com;M50 创意产业 16 号 50 号莫干山路 16 号楼 16 号楼及 18 号楼 h ， 周二至周四 10am-6pm，周五至周日 10.30am-6.30pm; m 江宁路） F

An original M50 gallery and one of Shanghai’s first contemporary art spaces, ShanghART is still going strong 20 years on.
香格纳艺术中心是最初的 M50 画廊 ，也是上海最早的当代艺术空间之一，20 年过去了，香格纳艺术展仍然屹立不倒。

Former Residence of Mao ZedongHISTORIC BUILDING
毛泽东故居历史建筑

(毛泽东旧居, Máo Zédōng Jiùjū; map Google map; %021 6272 3656; No 5-9, 120 North Maoming Rd, 茂名北路120弄5-9号; h9-11.30am & 1-4.30pm Tue-Sun; mWest Nanjing Rd) F
（ 毛泽东旧居 ， Máo Zédōng Jiùjū; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6272 3656;茂名北路 120 号 5-9 号， 茂名北路 120 弄 5-9 号 h 周二至周日上午 9-11：30 & 下午 1-4：30; m 南京西路） F

The Great Helmsman Mao Zedong lived here in the latter half of 1924 with his second wife, Yang Kaihui, and their two children, Anying and Anqing. The residence acts as a celebration of China’s national hero with old photos and newspaper clippings on display, but for many foreigners, the real highlight is the building itself.
1924年下半年，大舵手毛泽东与第二任妻子杨开慧以及两个孩子岸英、安庆一起住在这里。这座住宅是对中国民族英雄的庆祝，展出了老照片和剪报，但对于许多外国人来说，真正的亮点是建筑本身。

It’s a beautiful example of shíkùmén (stone-gate house) architecture. The displays are all in Chinese; bring a translator or app when you visit.
这是 shíkùmén（石门屋）建筑的美丽典范。展示全部为中文;访问时带上翻译或应用程序。
