1Pudong
1 浦东

oShanghai TowerNOTABLE BUILDING
o 上海中心大厦著名建筑

(上海中心大厦, Shànghǎi Zhōngxīn Dàshà; map; www.shanghaitower.com.cn; cnr Middle Yin-cheng & Huayuanshiqiao Rds; ¥180; h8.30am-9.30pm, last entry 8.30pm; mLujiazui)
（ 上海中心大厦 ， Shànghǎi Zhōngxīn Dàshà; 地图 ;www.shanghaitower.com.cn;银城中路和花园市桥路交叉路口;180 日元; h 上午 8：30 至晚上 9：30，最后入场时间为晚上 8：30; m 陆家嘴）

China’s tallest building dramatically twists skywards from its footing in Lujiazui. The 121-storey, 632m-tall, Gensler-designed Shanghai Tower topped out in August 2013 and opened in mid-2016. The spiral-shaped tower houses office space, entertainment venues, shops, a conference centre, a luxury hotel and ‘sky lobbies’. The gently corkscrewing form – its nine interior cylindrical units wrapped in two glass skins – is the world’s second-tallest building at the time of writing. The observation deck on the 118th floor is the world’s highest.
中国最高的建筑从陆家嘴的立足点上戏剧性地向天空扭曲。由 Gensler 设计的上海中心大厦高 121 层，高 632 米，于 2013 年 8 月封顶，并于 2016 年年中开业。这座螺旋形塔楼设有办公空间、娱乐场所、商店、会议中心、豪华酒店和“空中大堂”。在撰写本文时，轻轻拧开瓶的形式——其九个内部圆柱形单元包裹在两层玻璃皮中——是世界第二高的建筑。118 层的观景台是世界上最高的。

The twist is introduced by the outer skin of glass that swivels through 120 degrees as it rises, while atrium ‘sky gardens’ in the vertical spaces sandwiched between the two layers of glass open up a large volume of the tower to public use. The tower is sustainably designed: as well as providing insulation, the huge area of glass vastly reduces electrical consumption through the use of sunlight. The tower’s shape furthermore reduces wind loads by 24%, which generated a saving of US$58m in construction costs. Before the tower even went up, engineers were faced with building a 61,000-cu-metre concrete mat that would support its colossal mass in the boggy land of Pudong.
玻璃的外皮在上升时会旋转 120 度，而夹在两层玻璃之间的垂直空间中的中庭“空中花园”则向公众开放了塔楼的大量空间。该塔采用可持续设计：除了提供隔热效果外，巨大的玻璃面积还通过利用阳光大大减少了电力消耗。该塔的形状还将风荷载减少了 24%，从而节省了 58 亿美元的建设成本。在塔楼建成之前，工程师们就面临着建造一个 61,000 立方米的混凝土垫，以支撑浦东沼泽地的巨大质量。

Uppermost floors of the tower are reserved for that obligatory Shanghai attraction – the world’s highest skydeck above ground level – with passengers ferried in the world’s fastest lifts (64km/h), designed by Mitsubishi (and the world’s tallest single-lift elevator). Visitors can gaze down on both the Jinmao Tower and Shanghai World Financial Center below. A six-level luxury retail podium fills the base of the tower.
塔的最上层是为上海的必游景点——世界上最高的地面观景台——预留的，乘客乘坐由三菱设计的世界上最快的电梯（64 公里/小时）（也是世界上最高的单电梯电梯）。游客可以俯瞰下面的金茂大厦和上海环球金融中心。六层豪华零售裙楼填满了塔楼的底部。

oOriental Pearl TV TowerNOTABLE BUILDING
o 东方明珠电视塔著名建筑

(东方明珠广播电视塔, Dōngfāng Míngzhū Guǎngbō Diànshì Tǎ; map; %021 5879 1888; 1 Century Ave, 世纪大道1号; ¥160-260; h8am-10pm, revolving restaurant 11am-2pm & 5-9pm; mLujiazui)
（ 东方明珠广播电视塔 ， Dōngfāng Míngzhū Guǎngbō Diànshì Tǎ; 地图 ; % 021 5879 1888; 世纪大道 1 号 ; ¥160-260; h 上午 8 点至晚上 10 点，旋转餐厅上午 11 点至下午 2 点和下午 5 点至 9 点; m 陆家嘴）

This 468m-tall globe-on-a-tripod tower is the most iconic contemporary building in the city, and its image is omnipresent around town – from postcards to figurines and T-shirts. The highlight at this retro futurist Deng Xiaoping–era building is the Transparent Observatory (259m), where you can peer way down through the glass-bottomed walkway. To start your tour, take the lift to the 263m-high Sightseeing Floor for 360-degree views across to the Bund and its heritage buildings.
这座 468 米高的地球仪三脚架塔是该市最具标志性的当代建筑，从明信片到小雕像和 T 恤，它的形象无处不在。这座复古的未来主义邓小平时代建筑的亮点是透明天文台 （259 米），您可以透过玻璃底走道向下窥视。要开始您的旅行，请乘坐电梯前往 263 米高的观光层 ，360 度欣赏外滩及其历史建筑的美景。

Other features of the tower include a revolving restaurant at 267m, a Space Capsule Sightseeing floor, a 5D cinema and an indoor roller coaster – all of which are good options if you have kids in tow.
塔楼的其他特色包括海拔 267 米的旋转餐厅、太空舱观光楼层、5D 电影院和室内过山车——如果您有孩子，所有这些都是不错的选择。

oAurora MuseumMUSEUM
o 极光博物馆 MUSEUM

(震旦博物馆, Zhèn Dàn Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %021 5840 8899; www.auroramuseum.cn; Aurora Bldg, 99 Fucheng Rd, 富城路99号震旦大厦; ¥60; h10am-5pm Tue-Sun, to 9pm Fri, last entry 1hr before closing; mLujiazui)
（ 震旦博物馆 ， Zhèn Dàn Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 5840 8899;www.auroramuseum.cn; 富城路 99 号震旦大厦，福城路 99 号震旦大厦 ; ¥60; h 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 5 点，至周五晚上 9 点，最后入场时间为闭馆前 1 小时; m 陆家嘴）

Designed by renowned Japanese architect Ando Tadao, the Aurora Museum is set over six floors of the Aurora building and houses a stunning collection of Chinese treasures. Artefacts and antiquities on display include pottery from the Han dynasty; jade dating from the Neolithic to the Qing dynasty; blue-and-white porcelain spanning the Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasties; and Buddhist sculptures from the Gandharan and Northern Wei period. Don’t miss the jade burial suit made of 2903 tiles.
极光博物馆由日本著名建筑师安藤忠雄设计，位于极光大厦的六层楼上，收藏了令人惊叹的中国珍品。展出的文物和古物包括汉代陶器;从新石器时代到清代的玉器;跨越元、明、清三代的青花瓷器;以及犍陀罗和北魏时期的佛教雕塑。不要错过由2903瓦制成的玉葬服。

oShanghai World Financial CenterNOTABLE BUILDING
o 上海环球金融中心著名建筑

(上海环球金融中心, Shànghǎi Huánqiú Jīnróng Zhōngxīn; map; %021 5878 0101; www.swfc-observatory.com; 100 Century Ave, 世纪大道100号; observation decks 94th fl adult/child ¥180/120, 94th, 97th & 100th fl ¥220/160; h8am-11pm, last entry 10.30pm; mLujiazui)
（ 上海环球金融中心 ， Shànghǎi Huánqiú Jīnróng Zhōngxīn; 地图 ; % 021 5878 0101;www.swfc-observatory.com;世纪大道 100 号 ; 观景台：94 楼，成人/儿童 180/120 日元，94 楼、97 楼和 100 楼，220/160 日元; h 上午 8 点至晚上 11 点，最后入场时间为晚上 10 点 30 分; m 陆家嘴）

Although trumped by the adjacent Shanghai Tower as the city’s most stratospheric building, the awe-inspiring 492m-high Shanghai World Financial Center is an astonishing sight, even more so come nightfall when its ‘bottle opener’ top dances with lights. There are three observation decks – on levels 94, 97 and 100 – with altitude-adjusted ticket prices and wow-factor lifts thrown in. A clear, smog-free day is imperative, so check the weather and pollution index beforehand.
虽然被毗邻的上海中心大厦取代，成为这座城市最平流层的建筑，但令人敬畏的 492 米高的上海环球金融中心却是一个令人惊叹的景象，在夜幕降临时，它的“开瓶器”顶部与灯光共舞时更是如此。有三个观景台——位于 94、97 和 100 层——有海拔调整的票价和令人惊叹的电梯。晴朗、无雾霾的一天势在必行，因此请事先检查天气和污染指数。

The top two decks (at the bottom and top of the trapezoid) are known as Sky Walks. It’s debatable whether the top Sky Walk (474m) is the best spot for Shang-high views, though. The hexagonal space is bright and futuristic, and some of the floor is transparent glass, but the lack of a 360-degree sweep – windows only face west or east – detracts somewhat. But you get to look down on the top of the Jinmao Tower, which might be worth the ticket price alone.
顶部两层甲板（梯形的底部和顶部）被称为天空步道。不过，顶部天空步道（474 米）是否是欣赏上海高处景观的最佳地点还有待商榷。六边形的空间明亮而充满未来感，部分地板是透明玻璃，但缺乏 360 度全景——窗户只朝西或朝东——有些减损。但你可以俯瞰金茂塔的顶部，光是票价就可能物有所值。

Access to the observation deck is on the west side of the building off Dongtai Rd; access to the Park Hyatt is on the south side of the building. If you want to make a meal (or a cocktail) of it, or if lines are long, you can sashay into the Park Hyatt’s restaurant/bar 100 Century Avenue on the 91st floor instead.
通往观景台的通道位于东台路旁大楼的西侧;通往柏悦酒店的通道位于大楼的南侧。如果您想用它做一顿饭（或一杯鸡尾酒），或者如果排队很长，您可以进入柏悦酒店位于 100 层的 91 世纪大道餐厅/酒吧。

oShanghai DisneylandAMUSEMENT PARK
o 上海迪士尼乐园游乐园

(上海迪士尼乐园, Shànghǎi Díshìní Lèyuán; %021 3158 0000; www.shanghaidisneyresort.com; Shanghai Disney Resort, Pudong; adult/child 1-1.4m from ¥575/431; h8.30am-10pm; mDisney Resort)
（ 上海迪士尼乐园 ，Shànghǎi Díshìní Lèyuán; % 021 3158 0000;www.shanghaidisneyresort.com;上海迪士尼度假区，浦东;成人/儿童 1-1.4m 起 ¥575/431; h 上午 8.30 至晚上 10 点; m 迪士尼度假区）

Disney has magicked-up a spectacular theme park in Shanghai, offering a subtly Chinese take on Mickey and Co. Six themed areas encircle Disney’s biggest-ever Enchanted Storybook Castle, with attractions including a TRON roller coaster joining high-tech reboots of old favourites like Pirates of the Caribbean. With an estimated 350 million people living less than three hours away, expect long queues for rides – arrive before 9am if you plan to do it all in a day.
迪士尼在上海打造了一个壮观的主题公园，为米奇和他的公司提供了微妙的中国风格。迪士尼有史以来最大的魔法故事书城堡周围有六个主题区，景点包括波场过山车，以及加勒比海盗等老牌游戏的高科技重启。据估计，有 3.5 亿人住在不到三个小时的路程内，预计乘车会排起长队——如果您计划在一天内完成所有行程，请在早上 9 点之前到达。

China Art MuseumMUSEUM
中国美术馆 MUSEUM

(中华艺术宫, Zhōnghuá Yìshùgōng; 205 Shangnan Rd, 上南路205号; h10am-6pm Tue-Sun, last entry 5pm; mChina Art Museum) F
（ 中华艺术宫 ， Zhōnghuá Yìshùgōng; 205 Shangnan Rd， 上南路 205 号 h 10am-6pm Tue-Sun， Last Entry 5pm; m 中国美术馆） F

Set on the former site of the World Expo China Pavilion, this 160,000-sq-metre, five-floor, modern-art museum hosts some excellent international exhibitions, and the inverted red pyramid building is a modern icon of Shanghai. On the downside, the permanent Chinese art collection is prosaic with lots of propaganda, there’s a lack of information, and the layout is quite confusing. Any captions that do exist are clumsily translated.
这座占地 160,000 平方米、五层楼的现代艺术博物馆坐落在世博会中国馆旧址上，举办过一些优秀的国际展览，倒红色金字塔建筑是上海的现代标志。不利的一面是，永久性的中国艺术收藏平淡无奇，有很多宣传，缺乏信息，布局也相当混乱。任何确实存在的字幕都被笨拙地翻译了。

If you need a snack or drink stop, there is a Jamaica Blue cafe and a Starbucks on-site. Otherwise, across the road is the River Mall – although aside from Sichuan Folk, the choice there is pretty limited.
如果您需要小吃或饮料，酒店内设有牙买加蓝咖啡馆和星巴克。否则，马路对面就是 River Mall——尽管除了四川民俗之外，那里的选择非常有限。

Himalayas MuseumMUSEUM
喜马拉雅博物馆 MUSEUM

(喜玛拉雅美术馆, Xǐmǎlāyǎ Měishùguǎn; www.himalayasart.cn; Himalayas Center, 1188 Fangdian Rd, 芳甸路1188弄1号喜玛拉雅中心; h10am-6pm Tue-Sun; mHuamu Rd) F

In the eye-catching Himalayas Center (attached to the Jumeirah Himalayas Hotel), and formerly the Zendai Museum of Art, this art gallery is a fixture on the Pudong art scene, with an emphasis on contemporary exhibitions in a modern art space.
这家艺术画廊位于引人注目的喜马拉雅中心（附属于卓美亚喜马拉雅酒店），前身是善代美术馆，是浦东艺术界的固定设施，重点是现代艺术空间中的当代展览。

Jinmao TowerNOTABLE BUILDING
金茂大厦著名建筑

(金茂大厦, Jīnmào Dàshà; map; %021 5047 5101; 88 Century Ave, 世纪大道88号; adult/student/child ¥130/100/70; h8.30am-10pm; mLujiazui)
（ 金茂大厦 ，Jīnmào Dàshà; 地图 ; % 021 5047 5101; 世纪大道 88 号 ; 成人/学生/儿童 ¥130/100/70; h 上午 8.30 至晚上 10 点; m 陆家嘴）

Resembling an art deco take on a pagoda, this crystalline edifice is a beauty. It’s essentially an office block with the highaltitude Grand Hyatt map Google map (金茂君悦大酒店, Jīnmào Jūnyuè Dàjiǔdiàn; %021 5049 1234; www.hyatt.com; d ¥1500-2200; aiWs) renting space from the 53rd to 87th floors. You can zip up in the lifts to the 88th-floor observation deck, accessed from the separate podium building to the side of the main tower (aim for clear days at dusk for both day and night views).
这座水晶般的建筑类似于宝塔的装饰艺术风格，非常美丽。它本质上是一个办公楼，上面有高海拔的君悦地图谷歌地图 （ 金茂君悦大酒店 ， Jīnmào Jūnyuè Dàjiǔdiàn; % 021 5049 1234;www.hyatt.com;d 1500-2200 日元; a i W s ） 从 53 层到 87 层租用空间。您可以乘坐电梯拉上 88 层的观景台 ，从独立的裙楼进入主塔一侧（目标是在黄昏时分晴朗的日子，欣赏白天和夜景）。

Alternatively, sample the same view through the fizz of a gin and tonic at Cloud 9 map Google map (九重天酒廊, Jiǔchóngtiān Jiǔláng; %021 5047 8838; http://shanghai.grand.hyatt.com; 87th fl, 世纪大道88号87楼; h5pm-1am Mon-Fri, 2pm-2am Sat & Sun) on the 87th floor of the Grand Hyatt (accessed on the south side of the building), and photograph the hotel’s astonishing barrel-vaulted atrium.
或者，在 Cloud 9 地图上通过杜松子酒和滋补品的嘶嘶声来品尝相同的景色 谷歌地图 （ 九重天酒廊 ， Jiǔchóngtiān Jiǔláng; % 021 5047 8838;http://shanghai.grand.hyatt.com;87th fl， 世纪大道 88 号 87 楼 h ， 周一至周五 5pm-1am，周六和周日下午 2-2 点）， 位于君悦酒店 87 楼（可从大楼南侧进入），并拍摄酒店令人惊叹的桶形拱形中庭。

Shanghai Ocean AquariumAQUARIUM
上海海洋海洋馆 AQUARIUM

(上海海洋水族馆, Shànghǎi Hǎiyáng Shuǐzúguǎn; map Google map; %021 5877 9988; www.sh-soa.com; 1388 Lujiazui Ring Rd, 陆家嘴环路1388号; adult/child ¥160/110; h9am-6pm, last tickets 5.30pm; mLujiazui)
（ 上海海洋水族馆 ， Shànghǎi Hǎiyáng Shuǐzúguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 5877 9988;www.sh-soa.com;陆家嘴环路 1388 号， 陆家嘴环路 1388 号 ;成人/儿童 160/110 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 6 点，最后售票时间为下午 5：30; m 陆家嘴）

Education meets entertainment in this slick and intelligently designed aquarium that children will love. Join them on a tour through the aquatic environments from the Yangzi River to Australia and South America, and from the frigid ecosystems of the Antarctic to the flourishing marine life of coral reefs. The 155m-long underwater clear viewing tunnel has gobsmacking views. Feeding times for spotted seals, penguins and sharks are between 9.45am and 11.10am and 2.15pm and 3.40pm.
在这个设计巧妙、设计巧妙的水族馆中，教育与娱乐相结合，孩子们会喜欢。与他们一起游览从扬子江到澳大利亚和南美洲的水生环境，从南极寒冷的生态系统到珊瑚礁繁衍生息的海洋生物。155m 长的水下清澈观景隧道，景色令人目瞪口呆。斑海豹、企鹅和鲨鱼的觅食时间为上午 9 点 45 分至上午 11 点 10 分以及下午 2 点 15 分和下午 3 点 40 分。

DON’T MISS
不要错过

LONGTANG & SHIKUMEN
龙塘和石库门

Shanghai’s lòngtáng (or lǐlòng) lanes are the historic city’s principal indigenous urban architectural feature. Lòngtáng (弄堂) are the back alleys that form the building blocks of living, breathing communities, supplying a warm and charming counterpoint to the abstract and machine-like skyscrapers rising over the city.
上海的龙堂 （或龙龙 ）巷是这座历史名城的主要本土城市建筑特色。 弄堂是后巷，构成了生机勃勃的社区的基石，与耸立在城市上空的抽象和机器般的摩天大楼形成了温暖而迷人的对比。

Shíkùmén architecture is a unique mixture of East and West, a blend of the Chinese courtyard house and English terraced housing. Shíkùmén were originally designed to house one family, but Shanghai’s growth and socialist reorientation led to them being sublet to many families, each of which shared a kitchen and outside bathroom to complement the mǎtǒng (chamber pot).
Shíkùmén 建筑是东西方的独特混合体，融合了中式四合院和英式联排别墅。 石泉门最初设计为容纳一个家庭，但上海的发展和社会主义的重新定位导致它们被转租给许多家庭，每个家庭共用一个厨房和室外浴室，以补充 mǎtǒng（室内壶）。

1Xujiahui & South Shanghai
1 徐家汇和上海南部

Jiaotong UniversityUNIVERSITY
交通大学

(交通大学, Jiāotōng Dàxué; map Google map; http://en.sjtu.edu.cn; 1954 Huashan Rd, 华山路1954号; mXujiahui)
（ 交通大学 ，Jiāotōng Dàxué; 地图谷歌地图 ;http://en.sjtu.edu.cn;华山路华山路 1954 号 m 徐家汇 ）

Founded in 1896, Jiaotong University (literally ‘Transport University’) has a lovely, leafy campus, with well-kept lawns a short walk beyond the main gate and an old library building (图书馆, túshūguǎn). Climb to the 3rd floor of the library for a museum detailing the university’s history, complete with English captions. It’s a great place to go if the sun’s out – make like a student and collapse with a book on the grass among the magnolias.
交通大学（字面意思是“交通大学”）成立于 1896 年，拥有绿树成荫的美丽校园，正门外仅几步之遥，拥有维护良好的草坪和一座古老的图书馆大楼（ 图书馆 ，túshūguǎn）。爬到图书馆的三楼，可以看到一个详细介绍大学历史的博物馆 ，并配有英文字幕。如果太阳出来了，这是一个好去处——像学生一样，在木兰花丛中的草地上拿着一本书倒下。

1West Shanghai
1 上海西部

oQībǎoVILLAGE
o 奇堡村

(七宝; www.goqibao.com; 2 Minzhu Rd, Minhang, 闵行区民主路2号; high/low season ¥60/45; hsights 8.30am-4.30pm; mQibao)
（ 七宝 ;www.goqibao.com;闵行区民路 2 号，闵行区民主路 2 号 ;旺/淡季¥60/45; h 景点上午 8.30 至下午 4.30; m 七宝）

If you tire of Shanghai’s incessant quest for modernity, this tiny town is only a hop, skip and metro ride away. An ancient settlement that prospered during the Ming and Qing dynasties, it is littered with traditional historic architecture, threaded by small, busy alleyways and cut by a picturesque canal. If you can somehow blot out the crowds, Qibao brings you the flavours of old China. When you exit the station, head down Minzhu Rd and follow the signs to the Old Street.
如果您厌倦了上海对现代性的不断追求，那么这个小镇距离酒店仅几步之遥。这是一个在明清时期繁荣的古老聚落，散落着传统的历史建筑，蜿蜒着繁忙的小巷，被风景如画的运河所切割。如果你能以某种方式消除人群，七宝会给你带来旧中国的味道。出站后，沿民珠路行驶，按照路标前往老街。

There are nine official sights included in the through ticket, though you can also skip the ticket and just pay ¥7 to ¥15 per sight as you go. The best of the bunch include the Cotton Textile Mill, the Shadow Puppet Museum (performances from 1pm to 3pm Wednesday and Sunday) and Zhou’s Miniature Carving House. Half-hour boat rides along the canal slowly ferry passengers from Number One Bridge to Dongtangtan (东塘滩, Dōngtángtān) and back. Also worth ferreting out is the Catholic Church (天主教堂, Tiānzhǔ Jiàotáng; 50 Nanjie, 南街50号), adjacent to a convent off Qibao Nanjie, south of the canal.
直通票中包含九个官方景点，但您也可以跳过门票，只需支付 7 至 15 日元即可。其中最好的包括棉纺织厂 、 皮影戏博物馆 （周三和周日下午 1 点至 3 点表演）和周氏微型雕刻馆 。沿着运河乘船半小时，将乘客从一号桥缓慢地运送到东塘滩（东塘滩，Dōngtángtān）并返回。 同样值得一看的是天主教堂 （ 天主教堂 ，Tiānzhǔ Jiàotáng;50 Nanjie， 南街 50 号 ）， 毗邻运河以南七宝南街附近的一座修道院。

Wander along Bei Dajie north of the canal for souvenirs. South of the canal, Nan Dajie is full of snacks and small eateries, such as No 14, which sells sweet tāngyuán dumplings, and No 19, which is a rarely seen traditional teahouse.
沿着运河以北的北大街漫步，寻找纪念品。运河以南，南大街到处都是小吃和小餐馆，比如卖甜甜的唐元饺子的 14 号，以及罕见的传统茶馆 19 号。

Minsheng Art MuseumMUSEUM
民生现代美术馆 MUSEUM

(民生现代美术馆, Mínshēng Xiàndài Měishùguǎn; %021 6282 8729; www.minshengart.com; 570 West Huaihai Rd, 淮海西路570号; h10am-6pm Tue-Sun; mHongqiao Rd)
（ 民生现代美术馆 ，Mínshēng Xiàndài Měishùguǎn; % 021 6282 8729;www.minshengart.com; 淮海西路淮海西路 570 号 h 周二至周日上午 10 点至下午 6 点; m 虹桥路）

Although sponsored mainly by the Minsheng Bank, this edgy art space also counts the Tate, Centre Pompidou, MoMA and Guggenheim among its partners, so it should come as no surprise that the exhibits (about three per year) are generally excellent. Adding to its street cred is artistic director Zhou Tiehai, one of Shanghai’s best-known artists.
虽然主要由民生银行赞助，但这个前卫的艺术空间也包括泰特美术馆、蓬皮杜中心、现代艺术博物馆和古根海姆博物馆，因此展品（每年约三件）总体上非常出色也就不足为奇了。艺术总监周铁海是上海最著名的艺术家之一，为其街头声誉增添了色彩。

2Activities & Tours
2 活动与旅游

oDouble Rainbow Massage HouseMASSAGE
o 双彩虹按摩屋 MASSAGE

(双彩虹保健按摩厅, Shuāng Cǎihóng Bǎojiàn Ànmó Tīng; map Google map; %021 6473 4000; 45 Yongjia Rd, 永嘉路45号; 45/60/90min ¥72/108/144; hnoon-midnight; mSouth Shaanxi Rd)

Perhaps Shanghai’s best neighbourhood massage parlour, where the shared rooms have little ambience but the facilities are spotless and the prices are unbeatable. Choose your preference of soft, medium or hard, and the visually impaired masseuses here will work out your knots in no time and seek out those littlevisited pressure points. Try the traditional massage and herbal foot bath.
也许是上海最好的社区按摩院，这里的共用房间几乎没有氛围，但设施一尘不染，价格无与伦比。选择您喜欢的软、中或硬，这里的视障按摩师会立即解决您的结，并寻找那些鲜为人知的压力点。尝试传统按摩和草药足浴。

一流的男女皆宜的水疗中心，符合西方情感，并设有令人放松的客房。价格极具竞争力的按摩包括传统的中式全身按摩、油足按摩和热石按摩。如果想要更不寻常的东西，可以尝试温和的臀部调理按摩（仅限女性）。

Subconscious Day SpaMASSAGE
潜意识日间水疗按摩

The scent of lemongrass fills the air as you enter this serene, ecofriendly spa, which uses locally sourced materials, organic oils and non-toxic plants. A veritable centre for mind-body rejuvenation, Subconscious is on the pricier side, offering an array of traditional massages, from tuīná (traditional) and hotstone to Thai, as well as eight-person yoga classes and beauty treatments.
当您进入这个宁静、环保的水疗中心时，空气中弥漫着柠檬草的香味，该水疗中心使用当地采购的材料、有机油和无毒植物。作为名副其实的身心恢复活力的中心，Subconscious 的价格偏高，提供一系列传统按摩，从 tuīná（传统）和热石按摩到泰式按摩，以及八人瑜伽课程和美容护理。

UnTour ShanghaiFOOD & DRINK
UnTour 上海美食美酒

(www.untourfoodtours.com; per person from ¥450)
（www.untourfoodtours.com 人 450 日元起）

See a whole new side to Shanghai Old City on a night market food tour. Gregarious and knowledgeable guides introduce you to the city’s vibrant scene through a walk around neighbourhood alleys famous for their street food. There are also dumpling tours, where you get a cooking class, breakfast street eats, and private tours.
在夜市美食之旅中欣赏上海老城区的全新一面。善于交际且知识渊博的导游会在以街头小吃而闻名的街区小巷中漫步，向您介绍这座城市充满活力的场景。还有饺子之旅，您可以参加烹饪课程、早餐街头小吃和私人旅游。

The night markets food tour stops at sizzling stalls and neon-lit restaurants, giving you the chance to sample everything from chilli-oil-soaked crayfish to deep-fried water snake (butchered right there on the roadside), all washed down with beer and báijiǔ (a face-numbing spirit). It’s a fantastic way to learn about the diverse flavours and cooking styles within China.
夜市美食之旅在铁板摊位和霓虹灯闪烁的餐厅停留，让您有机会品尝从辣椒油浸泡的小龙虾到油炸水蛇（就在路边屠宰）的各种美食，所有这些都用啤酒和白酒（一种令人脸麻的烈酒）冲下去。这是了解中国多样化风味和烹饪风格的绝佳方式。

oShanghai PrideLGBT
o 上海骄傲 LGBT

(www.shpride.com; hJun)
（www.shpride.com; h 6）

While there isn’t a parade, the city’s annual celebration of the LGBTIQ+ community takes place in venues around town with film screenings, art events and educational activities, plus a rainbow bike ride and other social activities. The first-ever pride in China took place in Shanghai in 2009 at Cotton’s bar.
虽然没有游行，但该市一年一度的 LGBTIQ+ 社区庆祝活动在镇上的场所举行，包括电影放映、艺术活动和教育活动，以及彩虹自行车骑行和其他社交活动。2009 年，中国首次举行的骄傲活动在上海的 Cotton's 酒吧举行。

Lantern FestivalCULTURAL
元宵节文化

(元宵节, Yuánxiāo Jié; hFeb)
（ 元宵节 ，Yuánxiāo Jié; h 2 月）

The Lantern Festival falls on the 15th day of the first lunar month (15 February 2022, 5 Feruary 2023). Families make yuán xiāo (also called tāng yuán; delicious dumplings of glutinous rice with a variety of sweet fillings) and sometimes hang paper lanterns. It’s a colourful time to visit Yuyuan Gardens.
元宵节是农历正月十五（2022 年 2 月 15 日、2023 年 2 月 5 日）。家庭制作 yuán xiāo（也称为 tāng yuán， 美味的糯米饺子，配上各种甜馅），有时还挂纸灯笼。这是参观豫园的丰富多彩的时刻。

LOCAL KNOWLEDGE
当地知识

IDENTITY & THE SHANGHAI DIALECT
身份与上海话

Older Shanghainese are highly conscious of the disappearance of the Shanghai dialect (Shànghǎihuà), which is under assault from the increased promotion of the Mandarin (Pǔtōnghuà) dialect and the flood of immigrant tongues. It’s a deeply tribal element of Shanghai culture and heritage, so the vanishing of the dialect equals a loss of identity. Fewer and fewer young Shanghainese and children are now able to speak the pure form of the dialect, or can understand it only and prefer to speak Mandarin. Youngsters might not care, but older Shanghainese agonise over the tongue’s slow extinction. The most perfectly preserved forms of Shànghǎihuà survive in rural areas around Shanghai, where Mandarin has less of a foothold. The Shanghainese may remind themselves of the Chinese idiom – jiùde bù qù, xīnde bù lái (旧的不去新的不来; ‘If the old doesn’t go, the new doesn’t arrive’) – but it may offer scant consolation.
年长的上海人高度意识到上海话（Shànghǎihuà）的消失，上海话正受到普通话（Pǔtōnghuà）方言的日益推广和移民语言的泛滥的攻击。它是上海文化和遗产中深刻的部落元素，因此方言的消失等于身份的丧失。现在，越来越少的年轻上海人和儿童能够说纯正的方言，或者只能听懂它而更喜欢说普通话。年轻人可能不在乎，但年长的上海人对舌头的缓慢灭绝感到痛苦。保存最完好的山华形式在上海周边的农村地区幸存下来，那里的普通话不太有立足点。上海人可能会想起中国的成语——jiùde bù qù， xīnde bù lái（ 旧的不去新的不来 ;“如果旧的不去，新的就不会到来”）——但它可能提供很少的安慰。

Within a former post office, China’s first carbon-neutral hotel not only incorporates recyclable materials and low-energy products where possible, but also calculates its complete carbon footprint – including staff commutes and delivery journeys – and offsets it by donating money to environmentally friendly projects. The 26 open-plan rooms are beautifully designed using recycled brick and timber from a French Concession shíkùmén, with low furniture and sunken living areas that exude space.
在前邮局内，中国第一家碳中和酒店不仅尽可能采用可回收材料和低能耗产品，而且还计算其完整的碳足迹——包括员工通勤和送货行程——并通过向环保项目捐款来抵消。26 间开放式客房采用来自法租界 shíkùmén 的回收砖块和木材设计精美，配有低矮的家具和散发着空间气息的下沉式起居区。

Bathtubs are in the bedroom rather than in the bathroom (and sometimes right next to the bed!), while grey slate tiling and textured surfaces lend a distinctly urban vibe. Check out the cool wall behind reception arranged with a mosaic of well-travelled suitcases.
浴缸在卧室而不是浴室（有时就在床旁边！），而灰色石板瓷砖和纹理表面则营造出明显的城市氛围。看看接待处后面的凉爽墙壁，上面摆放着经常旅行的手提箱。

It also has the URBN Restaurant map Google map, a good alfresco dining spot to hang out in.
它还有 URBN 餐厅地图谷歌地图 ，这是一个很好的露天用餐场所。

（ 客家人 ， Kèjiā Rén; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6321 5888;www.hakkasan.com;中山东一路 18 号外滩 18 号 5 楼， 中山东一路 18 号 5 楼 ;餐费¥360-700; h 每天下午 5：30 至晚上 11 点，周五至周日上午 11 点至下午 3 点; m 南京东路）

At this acclaimed Cantonesecuisine restaurant, it’s all about high-end dim sum (such as jasmine-tea-smoked pork ribs) and luxurious mains like crispy Peking duck with imperial caviar. The decor is dark with heavy woods, seductive lighting and intricate Chinese partitions – though it doesn’t capitalise on its Bund views.
在这家广受赞誉的粤菜餐厅，提供高端点心（如茉莉花茶熏排骨）和豪华主菜，如脆皮北京烤鸭配御制鱼子酱。装饰是深色的，有厚重的木材、诱人的灯光和错综复杂的中式隔断——尽管它没有充分利用外滩的景色。

Wáng Bǎohé JiǔjiāSHANGHAI¥¥¥
Wáng Bǎohé Jiǔjiā 上海¥¥¥

(王宝和酒家; map Google map; %021 6322 3673; 603 Fuzhou Rd, 福州路603号; meals ¥80-600, set menu ¥450-800; h11am-1.30pm & 5-9pm; mPeople’s Square)
（ 王宝和酒家 ; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 021 6322 3673; 福州福州路 603 号福州路 603 号 ;餐费 80-600 日元，套餐 450-800 日元; h 上午 11 点至下午 1.30 和下午 5 点至 9 点; m 人民广场）

More than 250 years old, this restaurant’s claim to fame rests on its extravagant selection of crab dishes; its popularity reaches an apex during hairy-crab season (October to December). Most diners opt for one of the all-crabs-must-die banquets, but if you’re new to hairy crab, you might want to give it a try elsewhere before shelling out for an eight-course meal. Reserve.
这家餐厅拥有 250 多年的历史，其声名在于其丰富的螃蟹菜肴选择;它的受欢迎程度在大闸蟹季节（10 月至 12 月）达到顶峰。大多数食客都会选择全螃蟹必死的宴会之一，但如果您是大闸蟹的新手，您可能想在花钱吃一顿八道菜的大餐之前在其他地方尝试一下。储备。

LOCAL KNOWLEDGE
当地知识

EAT LIKE A LOCAL
像当地人一样吃饭

This is actually a little trickier than it sounds. If you’re wondering how you could not eat like a local, you only need to step into a western restaurant or bar any night of the week – in Shanghai, the temptations to stay in your comfort zone are everywhere. Eating Shanghainese-style may require an initial leap of faith (you want me to eat what?), but be brave and challenge your taste buds: with specialities such as freshly pulled noodles, braised pork belly and quick-fried shrimp, you won’t regret it.
这实际上比听起来要棘手一些。如果你想知道你怎么不能像当地人一样吃饭，你只需要在一周中的任何一个晚上走进一家西餐厅或酒吧——在上海，留在舒适区的诱惑无处不在。吃上海风味可能需要最初的信念飞跃（你想让我吃什么 ？），但要勇敢地挑战你的味蕾：新鲜拉面、红烧五花肉和速炸虾等特色菜，你不会后悔的。

5Shanghai Old City
5 上海老城区

Nanxiang Steamed Bun RestaurantDUMPLINGS¥
南翔馒头餐厅饺子¥

(南翔馒头店, Nánxiáng Mántou Diàn; map Google map; 85 Yuyuan Rd, Yuyuan Bazaar, 豫园商城豫园路85号; 12 dumplings on 1st fl ¥22; h1st fl 10am-9pm, 2nd fl 7am-8pm, 3rd fl 9.30am-7pm; mYuyuan Garden)
（ 南翔馒头店 ， Nánxiáng Mántou Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;豫园商城豫园路 85 号， 豫园商城豫园路 85 号 ;1 楼 12 个饺子¥22; h 第一层上午 10 点至晚上 9 点，第二层上午 7 点至晚上 8 点，第三层上午 9.30 点至晚上 7 点; m 豫园）

Renovated to spanking modernity in 2018, this is Shanghai’s most famous dumpling restaurant – some love it, others see an overrated tourist trap. Decide for yourself how the xiǎolóngbāo rate, but lines are long and you won’t even get near it on weekends. There are three dining halls upstairs, with the prices escalating (and crowds diminishing) in each room.
这家饺子餐厅于 2018 年进行了翻新，焕然一新，具有现代感，是上海最著名的饺子餐厅——有些人喜欢它，有些人则认为这是一个被高估的旅游陷阱。您可以自行决定 xiǎolóngbāo 的收费方式，但排队很长，周末您甚至无法靠近它。楼上有三个餐厅，每个房间的价格都在上涨（人群也在减少）。

The takeaway deal (including crab meat) is comparable to what you pay elsewhere for xiǎolóngbāo, but the queue snakes halfway around the Yuyuan Bazaar.
外卖优惠（包括蟹肉）与您在其他地方购买 xiǎolóngbāo 的价格相当，但排队的人在玉园集市的一半。

o El Willy 西班牙语 ¥¥

Ensconced in the stunningly converted South Bund 22, Willy Trullas Moreno’s fetching and fun restaurant is a more relaxed counterpoint to many other overdressed Bund operations. Seasonal scrumptious tapas and paellas are Willy’s forte, paired with some serene Bund views beyond the windows. 威利·特鲁拉斯·莫雷诺 （Willy Trullas Moreno） 的餐厅坐落在经过精心改造的南外滩 22 号，与许多其他衣冠楚楚的外滩餐厅形成鲜明对比。时令美味的小吃和海鲜饭是威利的强项，搭配窗外宁静的外滩景色。西班牙人和中国人都有共同的饮食方式，所以小吃和筷子效果很好。

One of Shanghai’s go-to addresses for fine dining, Napa plates up beautifully presented gastronomic dishes in an elegant Bund setting. The food combines elements of Asian and western cuisines, and, as the name suggests, there’s a strong emphasis on wine pairing. A good choice for a serious splurge.
纳帕是上海美食的首选地点之一，在优雅的外滩环境中提供精美的美食。食物结合了亚洲和西方美食的元素，顾名思义，非常注重葡萄酒的搭配。认真挥霍的好选择。
